Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place...Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: TankRivertowne
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. Can't wait ti return. Spent all day at vineyards then relaxed in this perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Luckydog1Boston
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised by the Embassy Suites - have stayed in other properties (Chicago, DC, etc) but this was really very nice. Excellent breakfast - made to order and fresh, and the inside courtyard/pond is delightful - complete with swans laying on hatching eggs! Rooms were as expected - clean, nothing fancy - but overall an excellent value and would stay again. The staff was extremely accomadating and very nice to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Napa.”
Reviews.Author: docJohnSanAntone
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice place to stay. The rooms are very spacious, and they have a great breakfast included with omlets to order. A bit noisy tho. Get the rooms in FRONT of the building because of the highway in back. We will stay here again when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Improved, but still working out the kinks”
Reviews.Author: Joebuyer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Napa Embassy Suites many times, most recently April 2012. They have recently completed renovations of the guest rooms to a modern look. The sitting area is an improvement both cosmetically and functionally. The bathroom door is still odd (it swings out into the living area). I saw a "model" of the renovations a few months ago, and could have sworn they changed the door to a sliding door that hugged the wall. They must have changed their mind, but it is still an improvement over the salon style doors from the old rooms. The bathroom is fresh and modern. No more tub, which is fine by me, but the new shower is long and narrow. I am average in size and felt it was a bit cramped (width). I would think larger people would not be happy. The water pressure was a tad on the low side and I had NO HOT WATER on day two (and I was not alone, many people complained). Although I did not watch TV during my stay, many people in my group complained they had no TV signal in their room. My TV remote in the bedroom did not work. When I checked the batteries, I noticed that they were leaking. If you like to go for a run, the area around is not real conducive to a long run. I did find a park nearby, but it is better suited for hiking, as there is quite a change in elevation. There was also no bellman service during my visit. Not sure if they cut back or if it was the time of year - they were pretty busy so, I don't think it was due to the time of year. On a good note, your stay does include the made to order breakfast, which is decent. The lines were long, but they moved quickly. It also includes the complimentary managers reception each might. The beer and hard liquor choices were poor and inconsistent with other Embassy Suites - the selection seems to be hit or miss (I assume they are independently owns and operated). Being in Napa, I would have expected a better selection. I do not drink wine, so I have no comment on their wine selection. Overall, a good place and good Value, but there is room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer W
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best court yard! It is so pretty with the little buildings, water, swan's and landscaping. A great place to enjoy the sun and sip on some wine!

Reviews.Title: “large but surprisingly cozy accoms”
Reviews.Author: bsmithSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: very pleasant environment. Large rooms, nice open spaces on property, very inviting to relax. Very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A little short of the mark for the price”
Reviews.Author: newindigo
Reviews.Content: Realizing the place has a monopoly on decent hotels in te area we payed almost $300 per night. Courtyard is beautiful with white and black swans. Room smelled of paint and even tape left on ceiling from recent paint job. Tv didn't work but breakfast was killer. Would give it another shot....

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Little Place”
Reviews.Author: Darin_and_Christi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights with our dog Payton. I have to say after our last two Hilton experiences I was not expecting much but I was pleasantly surprised. The courtyard front drive and lobby are beautiful The swans mill Pond are lovely and the staff was amazingly friendly. We had booked a pet room but with a tub but when we were shown our room it was a shower only room because they had moved us do to renovations on the courtyard. At first I was upset because I'd booked this months ago and felt they could have emailed told me the room I booked was unavailable but they went above and beyond to help do to the afore mentioned renovations they had to send someone to all the available rooms to find me a tub suite but they found one and we moved rooms with no hassle. The rooms a comfy tvs in both the living and bedrooms sinks in both living room and bedroom also. They had a full breakfast buffet with several types of muffins, bagels yogurts fruit and cereals to choose form as well as a made to order omelet station with sausage and bacon as well. The food was wonderful the drinks at the evening cocktail hour were very good as well as the chips and salsa cheeses and crackers. It was a very lovely vacation and makes me believe in Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and exchange in abundance!”
Reviews.Author: Kirkpatrickorion
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the honeymoon. Very nice. Close to everything you would want in napa and had a homey feel. Great food and free drinks and breakfast. My wife and I also felt very safe in the environment. My new favorite hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds and great free happy hour”
Reviews.Author: Jetman1
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, many rooms have just been remodeled. Good hot breakfast. Walls in rooms are thin. I was wakened in the middle of the night by the guy in the next room snoring? Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: sparkyjane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Embassy Suites last July and enjoyed our stay so much. The hotel is beautiful and very spacious. The grounds around the hotel are very relaxing with plenty of seating for the free happy hour and breakfast. The breakfast was made to order with many, many selections. We went on a wine tour with platupus and they picked us up right at the hotel. Sparky Jane Knoxville, Tn.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but stay away from freeway”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorSmart
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with good hot breakfast and newly remodeled room. But must get room away from Freeway or you will have to get up early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Kelly L
Reviews.Content: Okay.. One cannot go wrong by getting made to order omelettes every single morning. My room was recently remodeled and was divine. The beds super cozy. The staff super helpful (especially when I desperate one night for some Diet Coke). I love the manager's reception every night even though they didn't offer anything that I wanted to drink, I was still able to bring my own stuff in :) This place left such a good impression on me as it was my "compound" for 8 days.

Reviews.Title: “Good + !”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: Only our second visit here. Both times, front desk excellent, as were the bartenders in the restaurant. Wonderful environment, and we really enjoyed the baby ducks - watching (those who survived) become larger on our second visit! We enjoyed wine outside around the fireplaces the first time, not available (for some reason) the second time. King bed was saggy. However, we will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dbtravelor
Reviews.Content: We have used this hotel for several years for our conference for about 100 ladies. We have always been very pleased with staying here, until this year. A couple of people from the planning committee arrived one day early to find the hotel was under remodel. The remodeled rooms look great!! They have more available room the way they have reorganized the furnishings. However, we had contracted for a certain number of double rooms and were shorted by 9, which were king beds. The hotel compensated us for those lost double rooms and had trays sent up for those in Kings. During the week, the noise level of the remodel was very loud, but that was under control by Thursday when the ladies began to arrive. Some of the problem areas: our speakers had arrived on Monday, and could not access the free internet because their HiltonHHonors account is British and this hotel's website could not read it. They have an assortment of computers, pads, and phones, so if they were to use all these, it would have cost them $50.00 per day for the 6 days they were there for internet service. They travel worldwide, and had never stayed in a hotel that could not bundle these for them. Later, 2 ladies both had their curling irons on and it set off the fire alarm. The rooms were 63 degrees during the day and they do not turn on the heat until evening. They will bring up a radiator type heater if you call down to complain. My friend and I had our blow driers working at the same time and blew a fuse. We were told there was nothing they could do, we would have to work on our heir one at a time. We were spending one extra night, in a room next to the speakers. A family with 6 small kids (apparently all under the age of 7) checked in. Instead of putting them in a couple of rooms the conference ladies had vacated, they put half on either side of our rooms. The kids then raced back and forth for the next 3 hours. Later we learned that our visitor from England had had to endure a dog howling for over 2 hours before calling the front desk, who told her there was no dog because they had no contract for a dog. She finally went down to the front desk where she was told there was no one available to go up and check, that there was no dog. She informed them she was available to wait until someone was available. So finally they sent someone up, who of course heard the dog howling for HIMSELF (you mean people actually sneak large dogs into their rooms, then leave them to howl for hours to entertain the other guests who are trying to get some rest????) Of course they did!! We were not happy at all with the attitudes of: we can do nothing about smoke alarms going off or the rooms being so cold, or having to reset the electricity to the room when 2 appliances are being used simultaneously. The positive: the staff are all very friendly and do what THEY are allowed to do to assist. Especially one gentleman behind the desk, David. He went over and beyond, and we really appreciate him. We may have to find a new conference hotel for next year, sadly, since this facility is so beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Wyliegal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property last weekend and am very happy with my hotel choice. It was great to be able to walk from the hotel to downtown Napa. It is an easy walk past some very attractive heritage houses. Downtown Napa has been revitalized and has some attractive shops, restuarants and a wonderful public market. It is a very short drive to visit any of the wonderful local area wineries. The hotel is very attractive and has all the required amentities. The courtyard is a lovely spot to sit with a book and a glass of wine and unwind. I would certanly recommend it. The staff are accomodating and the recently redone rooms are superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: davebelden
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a great location just outside downtown Napa. Keith at the front desk was extremely helpful and made our stay fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and pleasant courtyard to watch the ducks”
Reviews.Author: 913Kiki28
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located property in Napa, easy walking to market and a terrific bakery. Internet service in the business center is glacial (think dial up) and the breakfast and maid staff were outstanding. We had a wonderful bartender at the complimentary happy hour upon arrival that was jovial and fun, which really set the tone for a superb experience. We have stayed at this property before and will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Newly refurbished hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: bobinlakeway
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised at new paint, furniture, rugs and bathrooms on our recent stay (Feb 23/24). However, the king sized bed needed to be replaced (sagged toward the middle). I would presume new beds are forthcoming. Agree with others that this is a lovely hotel in a good spot. The breakfast and happy hour are very good. Stayed in room 318. Rooms on the south side of the hotel facing the street have quite a bit of street noise - mostly due to the older design of the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Adventurer_Librarian
Reviews.Content: Visited my aunt who lives in Napa, with my sister and my honey. Trying to find a hotel for 3 people that do not want to sleep in the same room is not easy and can become pricey. This Embassy Suites is right off the highway so it's very easy to get to. Nice indoor and outdoor pool. Wine event in the breakfast room with snacks and wine everyday. Made to order breakfast every morning and in the room is information on what times are the most crowded. Lots of fresh fruit and healthy items. It was very quiet and the bed was awesome. Make sure to ask for AAA or AARP discount.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites needs to let guest control the temperature!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked into the Embassy Suites, Napa on February 12, 2012 into a very cold room. The temperature in the room was 58 degrees upon arrival. We soon discovered we could not control the temperature in our room. My wife called the front desk and she was informed the air handler was in neutral mode, which means you cannot get heat or air. The front desk said they would send a heater to our room. I got a great laugh when they showed up with a very small portable heater that could only heat the bathroom. After I finished laughing, I sent an email to the Hilton corporate office to express my disappointment. Unfortunately, my disappointment continued since it has been ten days and still no response, not even an automated response. While eating breakfast the next morning I notice more than half of the guest were wearing coats. Guess I didn’t have the only cold room.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine's Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Andrew611
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Easy access to the Napa Valley wine country. Great and convient to have cooked to order breakfast and the evening managers' reception. Renovated rooms look great. Our renovated room had heating and air conditioner that did not function. It was very hot at night and hard to get to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: shastabarb
Reviews.Content: This was nice, clean and comfortable. The food was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return”
Reviews.Author: oaklanding10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here for 5 nites in February for our anniversary. We were quite pleased with everything. The staff is very nice and very eager to please. The room was great with all amenities. The cooked to order breakfast every morning was amazing and the manager's reception in the afternoon quite nice. We had an upgraded suite on the first floor. It was quiet and convenient to everything in the hotel. Loved the indoor pool to get a little more exercise than just raising my glass. My only complaint would be that you do not have free wi-fi the the room. Also, the way the room is laid out and the kind of heating and cooling system means that the room gets a tad stuffy. They did, however, provide us with a box fan. Alll in all, I think this inn is a good value and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A few words of caution”
Reviews.Author: wineau1
Reviews.Content: I had a three-night stay in mid-January. I must have had a renovated room, because everything looked new. The whole coffee beans with grinder was an unexpected plus! Please note - the bottle of wine is complimentary, but the bottle of water is $5 - go figure. Of course, this is Napa so that might make sense. My room was on the top floor, so that helped with the noise from above. However, Embassy is hard against Highway 29, so make sure to ask for an interior facing room if you're noise sensitive. My sister had to change rooms after the first night. The front desk staff is very attentitive and helpful. The breakfast is pretty extensive, including an omelet station. Be aware that there can be a line at certain times. Also, they are in such a hurry to get the omelet out that the cheese will be cold. If you actually want the cheese melted, ask for your omelet "well done". The fresh red grapefruit was the best, sweetest I have ever had. One negative is the yogurt was the "lite" variety with artificial sweetener; yuck! I would stay there again, but be VERY picky about which room.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Crashdavis613
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when visiting Mom for Xmas. Good Location staff was friendly. Cool courtyard with swans. Good breakfast friendly servers.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to get to and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: amarion
Reviews.Content: The hotel was right off the freeway, which does put it right next to the freeway and you do get noise, but it's easy to get to. They have decent rooms with all the amenities you need. The pool indoor is great with the kids, but needs to be heated more. It's still quite cool and even the kids couldn't stay in for too long. Still, in the winter, it was nice to have for a bit. It is also open until midnight. Our room was on the 3rd floor of the atrium area, and we did get a lot of noise early in the morning (5am) when they were setting up for breakfast downstairs. The happy hour was very nice and the kids really loved it, along with the great morning breakfast. The grounds of the hotel are really beautiful with swans and lush areas. All in all, it was a good experience and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel under construction.”
Reviews.Author: passionfortravel3
Reviews.Content: We have come to this hotel for years on business. The staff are always so very pleasant and accommodating, the location is excellent for having a base to go wine tasting. No pretty views and close to freeway and major streets, but you can walk to grocery store & shops. Right now, the hotel is under construction but the front desk will let you check out rooms before you settle in. I am quite impressed with the construction methodology. They are progressing around the hotel, renovating 3 levels at a time & very mindful of guests. If you need to use the conference rooms, beware, as they will be under construction early 2013. The new rooms are very nicely decorated, a comfortable living room, refrigerator & microwave. Breakfast is included but goes off early at 9am. When construction is completed, the hotel will have a gym & spa. The inner atrium of the hotel is very serene & peaceful with a garden & swans swimming in a pretty natural environment. I hope this feature does not go away with the renovation. All in all, a comfortable hotel in central location, reasonable rates & friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Place to Stay In Napa”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: After a less than pleasant experience recently at the River Terrace Inn, we were searching for a new place to stay on our frequent trips to Napa. I decided to give Embassy Suites a try since we are HHonors members. We were both delighted with our stay. It is true that the rooms could use some refurbishing, but I believe they are in the process of doing that, because I saw a swatch board in the lobby. Having two flat screen TVs, especially during the football playoffs, was great. The hotel doesn’t have a gym, but they give guests free passes to an excellent gym about a mile away on California Street. That gym is much better than any hotel gym, so we were happy with that. The free breakfast is excellent. There is an omelet station where you can get omelets and other kinds of eggs, bacon, sausage, breakfast potatoes and pancakes. They also had various breads, cereals, yogurt and juices. We were very impressed with all the staff and will definitely be back in the near future for another enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Spot”
Reviews.Author: usmalum79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites and we have only good things to say. The hotel grounds were beautiful and our room was very nicely decorated and clean. The hotel provided whole bean coffee and grinder in the room, a first for us in a hotel. Made us feel right at home. All of the staff we encountered were extremely helpful and pleasant. David, at the front desk, was especially friendly and most helpful. The hotel still had their Christmas decorations up which created a very festive atmosphere. The reviews we read on trip advisor were instrumental in our choosing to stay at Embassy Suites. We were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, peaceful, great rooms beautiful setting!”
Reviews.Author: Pheephox
Reviews.Content: a lovely setting, swans, ducks in the pool, great rooms, and would have got an excellent, but for the hot water being out just when I needed to use it, and for the fact my keys got blocked because they hadn't asked for a credit card on check in and therefore I owed $9.95 for the internet - as a Hilton Honors member they do have all my details on file and therefore this is a rather petty way to deal with a charge that small... and a lot of hotels would give free internet just because of the inconvenience of the hot water being out- I don't like going out to something important and my hair not looking its best because I can't wash it! but still a gorgeous property and rooms with very nice decor and off-season rates are pretty decent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, need to update rooms, they are very worn”
Reviews.Author: lovesdogskansas
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel, get up go get breakfast and get on your way. I have stayed the last three years, I would like it to get updated and refreshed. I am not staying there anymore until they do, especially for what we pay per night. I will check back to see if they updating the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “great value in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Aim_8
Reviews.Content: I love this place. Every year we run the Napa Valley Marathon, and always stay here. Quaint, sprawling hotel layout. Has both an outdoor cold pool and heated indoor pool. They have an incredible happy hour in the evening (lots of snacks plus wine/beer), and a bountiful breakfast (including made-to-order eggs/pancakes, etc.), all included. Rooms are multi-room, clean, and spacious. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, OK service”
Reviews.Author: Travelinscott
Reviews.Content: If you have visions of looking out your window at vineyards or rolling hills, look elsewhere. This hotel is in the city of Napa right off of highway 29 and I had a view of a freeway offramp and garbage dumpsters in the parking lot below. Like most Embassy Suites, nice property but it seemed old. We had water problems the afternoon of arrival and the shower was lukewarm at best the following morning with little water pressure. The room was typical Embassy Suites with average cleanliness. Everything except the water worked OK. The breakfast was very nice and the inner courtyard was very relaxing. The front desk staff was friendly but no more than what is expected nowadays. As a Hilton Diamond member, there should have been water and a snack in my room but it never arrived. That's a small problem but indicative of average service. Next time in Napa I will return to the Hilton Garden Inn just up the road a little farther.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Lindism
Reviews.Content: Location was good, just off highway to all wineries. We were there for a night, rooms good size. Managers reception drinks & snacks from 5.30 - 7.30 was a bonus. Keith, front manager, was terrific in assisting us with wineries to visit & just great service. Will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Want to go back and spend more time enjoying the hotel amenities. . .”
Reviews.Author: DEBRAPELLOUSO
Reviews.Content: Did not get to enjoy all they offer, but will make a point to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hate to be negative!”
Reviews.Author: mikereply
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a classic E.S. set up, which was always a little "too much walking" if you ask me. When your lugging luggage around, the last thing you want to hear is "take the elevator to 3 walk to the end of the ramp, turn right walk to the end of that walkway turn right and your room is right there". He didn't mention... The walkways are 2 city blocks long! (now I'm just ranting, sorry!) On a better note- the food in the main restaurant was delicious and priced for the area. Nothing was unaffordable. I have stayed at this hotel many times and find one major problem very consistent with any room you are placed in- THE INTERNET connection sucks! The only option is a wireless connection that seems to move in waves. You will have a "good connection" one second and then.... Nothing. It will do this all day and night. At no point is it reliable. If your a Internet news junkie (as I am), better keep your phone or paid AT&T or Verizon IPads close by, because your computer signal will frustrate you more than anything at this hotel. The people are always nice and friendly. And if you do stay at this hotel, and visit the morning breakfast, make sure to tip the ladies making your eggs! They are always a delight and greet you with a smile, but for some reason everyone forgets to tip them the way you would anywhere else! Any questions on my review my email address is miketripadviserreply@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, Noisy, Smelly”
Reviews.Author: CorporatePilot62
Reviews.Content: Property in desperate need of renovation. First room smelled like mold, changed rooms different unpleasant odor. Noisy highway behind second room. Included average breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice value, but under construction”
Reviews.Author: rend
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to many wineries and is a good value considering there is a very nice breakfast included in the per night stay. We have stayed here several times and have enjoyed our stay. A couple of things to consider before you book, in October 2011 they were doing some restoration/construction work. We had painting and fumes right outside our door. They did not inform us of this work prior to booking. We tried to find another room in Napa, however hotels were full. Also, it was quite warm while we were there in October. The thermostat is controlled by the hotel, in other words there is a certain temperature you can turn it down to and no further. Not sure how that will work with heat, probably controlled also. All in all a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Old property, rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: Barbsrubyslippers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in close proximity to most Napa Valley wineries, and downtown Napa. This is almost enough to consider overlooking the old interior room decor or noise from the freeway, but not quite. The exterior property and lovely center court pond is exceptionally maintained. The free breakfast is also fresh. To keep your breakfast from becoming too cold, sit away from the doors, where people (seemingly oblivious) create an endless trail of foot traffic as they cut through the courtyard, holding doors open, instead of walking around through the hallways. Breakfast consist of eggs anyway you choose, pre-frozen potatoes warmed on a griddle, limp bacon, sausage links, plenty of hot pancakes, various assortment of breads and cereals, coffee and juices. The ladies preparing the food are very friendly and accommodating, so bring a few dollars for their tip basket, if you are so inclined. When we arrived, the hotel has just gone into "heat mode" and we heard the front clerk tell another patron that it would take an hour or more to have the rooms heat up. Our room, on the back side had a sliding glass door open up to a parking lot overlooking the highway 29 entrance ramp. Noise was very loud until after 8 pm. We attempted to request another room but the front desk was unwilling to help. The thermostat only controlled the amount of heat in the room, and despite highway noise, each night we had to open the sliding glass door for ventilation. Mini kitchen was equipped with a small fridge and ice cube tray. Bath product are sparse, Evelyn & Crabtree, avocado citrus. When looking for restaurants, there are several very good options in downtown Napa, off Main and First.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent quality, good value”
Reviews.Author: Joebuyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several times. You have the typical Embassy Suites amenities, but this location is one of the best. Rooms are good size, beds are comfortable and furnishings are nice. They are getting ready for a complete remodel and I have seen "sample" rooms. The new rooms are very modern and have a great updated look and feel. Once complete, I think you will be pleasantly surprised. Staff is very cordial and helpful. As usually, your stay includes free managers reception and cook to order breakfast. N joy!

Reviews.Title: “Decent but Very Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: smarty74
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our first year wedding anniversary. At over $300 per night I really thought that I was getting something special. I was disappointed. This hotel is essentially an upgraded Days Inn/Holiday Inn that should cost between $125-$150 per night in Napa. If you pay within that range you will likely be content with the hotel, but if you pay more you will feel very ripped off because this is not an upscale/luxury hotel by any stretch of the imagination. You get a tidy room and suite in an older well maintained building without much frills. The selling point is a beautiful courtyard but it is offset by a very cold atrium, skimpy breakfast, and poor "manager's reception". The hot water was out when my wife was trying to take a shower and loud people were walking back and forth outside of our room which was at the courtyard level. If I paid $125 per night I would shrug these things off and be relatively content, but at over $300 per night, the poor quality of this hotel put a damper on our first year wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, dank, don't-dare-upack, musty, moildy rooms.”
Reviews.Author: JoeOnTheGoe
Reviews.Content: When we walked into the room, the smell hit us like a ton of bricks and never left, no matter how hard we tried to air-out the place. Reminiscant of visiting grandma at the nursing home, if grandma lived in a van under a bridge down by the river where the sun don't shine. Anywhere except Napa, this place could't qualify for a Motel 6 franchise. Nice paint job, though.

Reviews.Title: “Standard rooms need some updating”
Reviews.Author: edenlky
Reviews.Content: Location is good, staff are very friendly but property need some updating for sure. Standard embassy suite offering except for quality of rooms. However, it is one of the few hotels in town who does not have 2 nights minimun stay.

Reviews.Title: “Napa....good.”
Reviews.Author: CopaSis
Reviews.Content: About a mi Easywalk into downtown, about a mile. Good breakfast. Manager reception is old peeps looking for good, free Napa wine.....(not) Rooms are great & offer a spin on the norm Embassy. Ask for top floor.....or expect noisy upstair neighbors as floors are hollow & wooden?? If you wish to sleep past 6am.....and front desk does not help to notify your noisy neighbors of their rude morning habits.

Reviews.Title: “Despite it's faults, it's a pleasant place ...”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: We spent this past weekend at the ES Napa ... and although it's not perfect, we had a lovely stay. First of all, as others have mentioned, the bathroom doors are really odd. I think we would have taken issue with them had our kids been with us ... they snap shut like cabinet doors, and when opened, block the entrance to the bedroom. The bathroom itself seemed to be an afterthought in an otherwise spacious and pleasant room. Next was the fact that, despite being HH Diamond members, we were placed in a dark, corner room (most likely because we were on points the first night). We got over that fact. Finally, the breakfast was a little disorganized, and required a ticket (have never seen that before at an ES). You get your bacon, potatoes and sausage at the omelet bar, rather than from a buffet. This creates a really long line - that should be addressed. On the bright side, the hotel is very attractive, easy to find, has plenty of parking, and friendly service. The NON-minibar refrigerator is a huge plus (there are a Trader Joe's AND a Whole Foods up the road at Bel-Aire Plaza), we were able to get our own dinner both nights and bring it back to our cozy little room. (Lunch, in Yountville was another, very pleasing, matter). We didn't use the pool, but it looked very pleasant, the breakfast area was huge, and the lobby spotless. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: diachris
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Embassy Suites in October 2011 for 3 nights. Pros: Location, it's very close to the downtown Napa Area. Two blocks away from a grocery store Staff- Everyone was very nice, from check-in to check-out Breakfast- Complimentary breakfast was great. Cooked to order eggs, omlettes with bacon and potatoes. They have a manager's happy hour but we didn't have the chance to try it. Grounds- The ponds were so pretty. They have both white and black swans. There are multiple outside tables where you can sit and relax. One night we had a bottle of wine and just relaxed. Cons: Dated Room- The room could use some updating. There was a smell when we walked in, not sure what it was. Didn't care for the bed or pillows. The bathroom doors also drove me crazy. There were two small doors that you needed to pull together to close, also no locks. They are also working on doing some outside renovations but it didn't distract from our experience. Our next stay I might check out another property until some more updates are done.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms and Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: wonderfulworld
Reviews.Content: We liked everything about this older property except for the bellboy. When I called down for a regular coffeemaker to replace the one-cup coffee maker in our room a young, heavy-set man showed up with coffee for the one-cup coffee maker and the news that no large coffeemakers are available. When I gave him a generous tip, he turned on his heels without saying thank you. A little later a lovely lady from housekeeping appeared with a regular coffee maker and a generous supply of coffee. She more than made up for the slacker bellboy who hasn't been trained to say thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Napa good, Embassy Suites not so good”
Reviews.Author: Maze1
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Thursday and asked for a room on first floor. The room was in a hallway near an exit door, no daylight except to look out the back to a parking lot of cars. Room absolutely reeked of mold and when walking barefoot on the carpet it felt damp (only did that once). Floor in bathroom was dirty; I put my used towel on the floor and moved it - it had dirt marks on it, and it wasn't from me! Couldn't stand it and asked for another room on second floor on Saturday. Hubby and I waited until I went down to front desk at 2pm to ask if this new room was ready. Of course it was, probably hours earlier and nobody tells us. Had to get ready for a wedding and the desk people acted like they could care less about not informing us of the room readiness, and seemed put out that they had to move us at all. Second room on the second floor much better, no smells, lighter. Still pretty second rate for the money. Walls very thin. Only thing going for this place was the location, close to highway/Napa/wineries. Also one desk clerk said they would comp us one night in the unlivable room but that never happened. We just wanted to get out of there and didn't even want to bother debating that issue. Go somewhere else and stay, I couldn't drink enough wine to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: FLP_11
Reviews.Content: True it is a little dated but the property is well maintained, as you would expect from Hilton. All staff members were pleasant. Sure Embassy Suites are more expensive but you get cooked to order breakfasts and the manager's reception.

Reviews.Title: “not bad but very overpriced”
Reviews.Author: michleec
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for a wedding this past weekend. We were three people--a couple and a single person so needed a two-room suite. This place was all we could find. Pros--nice grounds, a plentiful breakfast buffet included in the price, the rooms were nicely appointed with good amenities and the staff was accommodating. They also have a reception each evening with drinks and snacks though the snacks were popcorn and tortilla chips and the wine was poor quality--surprising considering we were in Napa.Two pools one indoor, one outdoor. Cons-near the highway, the room was dark and had a view of the parking lot and dumpster. Please note that the hotel has kind of a strange layout so that the rooms face out onto the courtyard or an atrium. We were given a room on the ground floor and couldn't even open the shutters because people were constantly walking by or sitting at tables right outside the window looking in at us. Zero privacy, plus noisy. We complained and the person at the front desk moved us to the third floor with no problem. Biggest complaint was the price. We had a suite and with tax the bill came to nearly $900 for two nights. We expected more for that price. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: Piqua41
Reviews.Content: For high-priced Napa, this is a great choice because of its convenient location near Hwy. 29 so you can zip north to the wineries and/or Sonoma, and also within reasonable walking distance to downtown Napa. The layout of this Embassy Suites is unique - more outdoorsy and Spanish in design - with several courtyards, pools, swan ponds, etc. It has the usual wonderful Embassy Suites delights plus a great front desk staff who helped us find the nearest In and Out Burger location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: Lvisco
Reviews.Content: This was one of our three hotels that we stayed during our recent trip to Napa and San Francisco, and it was our favorite! Beautiful property, friendly attentive staff, clean facility and a great breakfast experience! Close to downtown Napa and convenient to the major highway leading to the wineries. We had requested a room with a view of the courtyard area, but we given a room down a dark hall with a view of the back parking lot & a tv that did not work. Front desk accomodated a change immediately - not sure why we were given that first room to begin with... They pack a lot into the suite - sitting area, bar area, seperate bedroom. One weird design element is the narrow double doors to the bath -- they did not seem to want to stay open or closed -- might have been better if they went with a pocket door if they needed to save space in the suite.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location for Winerys...But a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: Super-Mom-of-4
Reviews.Content: Heres my thought on this hotel. We just recently returned from an amazing and wonderful trip to Napa Valley and decided to stay at the embassy suites in Napa Valley. This was our first trip in 5 years with just my husband and I without the kids.. The pros: Location wise, i thought the hotel was well situation in terms of the wine trail and winerys we visit. It was convienently located in the Napa Valley area. The other pro was it was only 20 minutes from SOnoma, so this made our vacation even better because we were able to easily visit the Sonoma are as well. Theres a adorable historic area filled with wonderful shops and resturants we discovered when we decided to have dinner at "The girl and the Fig" resturant. Great dining choice because of location, food, and has a great outside dining area. WEbsite is http://www.thegirlandthefig.com . We like this little downtown area so much we decided to return for another visit the next day and had breakfast in town Also, another great perk of the hotel was breakfast was included with your stay. Great omlete station and great choices to pick from And parking was free which is always a great feature to have CONS: i though the hotek was nice....nothing too over the top. I though the price of $350 a night was excessive. We actually used our hilton points to reserve the room and it was almost 50,000 hilton points to stay. overall, i though it was a little much for the room and hotel accomodations. also, wifi was an additional cost Overall...greta stay, hotel was good but pricey, and location was perfect. I would maybe consider staying again IF i scored a better nightly rate on the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: tia22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a family trip in July. Loved the grounds of this property with the lush landscaping and ponds with swans. It was relaxing to sit next to the ponds and enjoy the free drinks at happy hour. Breakfast was great, with a huge selection. It's also served in a large room, so it never felt too crowded. I've stayed at other Embassy Suites that have a better happy hour with actual food. This one had just chips and popcorn. The room was clean with comfortable beds and the linens were all in good condition. The only downside was the windows don't block out much street noise, so if you are a light sleeper you will most likely hear traffic noise. We asked for a room on the street side instead of the rooms that face Hwy 29, and there was still traffic noise. Stayed at the River Terrace Inn during last trip to Napa. It was a nicer property, but this hotel had a better rate. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gets the Job Done”
Reviews.Author: Rolayna
Reviews.Content: The rooms aren't anything to write home about, but they are comfortable. The service was acceptable, and the grounds were kept well enough. It wouldn't be a bad idea to remodel/renovate, but there is no dire need to do so either. Breakfast was great, and this is an otherwise acceptable place to stay in advance of all of your Napa Valley adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate for our needs”
Reviews.Author: akjane71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Napa Valley marathon in March, 2011. It was the perfect property for my brother and I. It's nice to have 2 full beds and a separate living area. Since we were both on different time zones, it gave us a place to be when 1 was up but the other wasn't. The location was perfect, about 1 mile from an outlet mall and just a few to the hub-bub of Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: TGChan
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for the price near downtown Napa. Bedroom and bathrooms are pretty up to date, but living room could use newer furniture. However, it is quite spacious and kitchenette has a refridgerator and microwave. Also includes free made-to-order breakfast. Cute little courtyard pool and pond.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate accommodation, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Retired_engineer_58
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a bit tired though comfortable enough. There is a lot of noise from adjoining rooms, particularly those above. Breakfast and evening cocktails were good and not too crowded. Garden courtyard is pleasant, but outdoor pool is small for size of hotel. Front desk staff very pleasant and helpful with local attractions. Hotel is located fairly close to the town centre, where there is easy parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good stopping place for Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkCommonMan
Reviews.Content: Brisk, efficient check-in. Large, clean room. Lovely central garden and pond. Restaurant a bit 'iffy' in the evening - we were ignored for quite a while waiting to be seated, and the waitress seemed to be more interested in talking to other customers about trivia than attending to us! t Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - great friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JJK1976
Reviews.Content: Hotel was good....could use some updating. The highway is directly behind hotel so can be noisy at times. Great home base for touring wineries. Staff was extremely helpful, especailly the Mgr in Grille 29. She gave us a lot of great recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: rosieg18
Reviews.Content: When I am in a hotel the thing I am most concerned with is the cleanliness of the room. When we checked in our bathroom still had old / wet towels hanging in the shower. Obviously whoever cleaned the room didn't look and or clean inside the shower or they would have seen the towels. I reported it to the front desk and they did not seem very apologetic. The lobby was nice - but the common areas inside where the wine/snacks served had a musty odor. Won't return.

Reviews.Title: “I like embassy!”
Reviews.Author: Iloveroom69
Reviews.Content: Well i must say, for the most part napa is pretty snazzy! I think the Laura is just great, and although I had stayed there before, I was confused on why her husband Jeff the limo driver whom we met at the hotel a while back was not there anymore, she seemed very disappointed. But anyhow, Laura and kris were some of our favorite staff! They made the already beautiful room much more enjoyable and the breakfast was wonderful! Kurtis had helped us several times throughout the time we stayed there and he was one of the most friendly bellmen we had ever met, who was definitely willing to go out of his way to do things for us! Anyhow, great stay will be back again! Thanks you embassy!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: jthreed
Reviews.Content: This is a great Embassy Suites. The courtyard is lovely. The cocktail reception and full breakfast make traveling so easy and relaxing. The rooms are spacious with a sitting room, small dining table, microwave and fridge and a bedroom with a door to separate it from the rest of suite. Easy access to highway St Helena and wineries.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but not great”
Reviews.Author: K K
Reviews.Content: The exterior, lobby, and courtyard for this hotel are great but the rooms are decorated very strangely - kind of old west victorian bordering on brothel looking. Unfortunately, in two nights, we stayed in two hotels. They messed up our honeymoon reservation and booked us into a room with two double beds and insisted til the end that we had booked it that way. Our itinerary from the travel agent said honeymoon couple so we know that is not true. In the next breath, they offered to upgrade us the second night to a romantic suite. It was simply a king size bed and two robes in the closet. The hotel is right off the main road in Napa (29) and there was road noise and construction noise all night. They do offer a manager's cocktail reception at night but it was nachos, popcorn, and badly done drinks. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was pretty standard and fairly nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property!”
Reviews.Author: Brittany184
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights for an anniversary trip. This is a very nice hotel, and all the staff were friendly and helpful. I loved the courtyard area with the ponds and swans, it is beautiful and relaxing. The outdoor swimming pool was really nice as well, but could get a little noisy as our room was right near it. The decor was out dated, but everything was very clean, housekeeping did a great job! We really liked the complimentary breakfast, except the lines were long nearly every day. The manager's reception was very nice also with the free drinks and snacks. We enjoyed the on site restaurant / lounge area, the bartenders were very friendly, and room service was good also. We had a problem ordering a pay per view movie one night, and the maintenance person showed up and fixed everything quickly which was nice especially because it was around 8 pm, we weren't sure if someone would be there to help us. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Understanding, compassionate people work here”
Reviews.Author: rokalada
Reviews.Content: Took a bereavement trip with our mother's ashes to California with two sisters, and I mistakenly made our reservation for June, when we were supposed to be there in July. When we showed up in July, they not only found us a room on a sold-out weekend, but they also refunded what they had charged my credit card for the no-show in June. That was pretty astounding to me, and I so appreciated it! The hotel courtyard is lovely - a pond with two sets of swans floating around. The cocktail hour(s) was also great, serving mixed drinks and wine, beer and frozen margaritas. Breakfast was wonderful. Our room was a quiet side, and it was just perfect. Thank you, Embassy Suites! We are staying with you again this month.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Haellostinside
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the ground floor in one of the disabled modified suites, so there were adaptions in the bathroom excetera for this purpose. I would suggest unless you require the modifications, it would be better to request one of the suites without. The suite itself was still very good though (clean and spacious), however we only stayed for two nights so did not get an opportunity to utilise the kitchenette or lounge much. A buffet breakfast was included which was very good and as a vegetarian I was pleased with the selection offered, which included a made to order omlette bar. In the evenings between around 5-7pm they also offered a managers reception where you could get free drinks and snacks. If you tipped at least $1 per drink though, the barman would be more generous with the wine! The grounds inside the complex are pretty as there is a large decorative pond with white and black swans. There is also free parking at the front of the complex. It takes about 15-20 minutes to walk into the centre of town, so it is still quite far out but it depends where you want to go. The receptionist was very helpful and recommended and booked a winery tour for us (on short notice) with Platypus Tours, it was about $100 per person to take you out for the whole day to 4 different wineries. I would definately recommend this tour as although you had to pay wine tasting fees still, these were often waived if you made a purchase, lunch was included in the tour and you did not have to worry about transport whilst drinking!

Reviews.Title: “Girls overnight trip”
Reviews.Author: fawna1
Reviews.Content: We went to Napa to do some wine tasting and stayed at the Embassy Suites Hotel overnight. What a wonderful place with great service and a beautiful courtyard that is home to a pair of White and Black Swans. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff/ great breakfast/ very nice property”
Reviews.Author: BrownBoyOntario
Reviews.Content: from the beginning of our trip to Napa and up to when we checked out, the staff were very helpful. They gave us excellent recommendations of wineries and restaurants. My travel companion wanted halibut for dinner and the staff went well beyond their call of duty by calling restaurants for me and locating a restaurant that serves halibut. please note that check-in time is at 4pm. The probability of getting an early check-in or late check out is almost impossible. The breakfast was great too.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Hotels4mee
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful! Grounds are amazing! The staff, including Kurtis,Laura, Severo, David, were great, but one team member almost made us want to leave and that was Keith Burhorn. He was incredible impatient with us and didn't even seem to care about us and our needs. Although we only came to the desk a couple times, the staff listed above (disregarding Keith) were amazing and really made us feel appreciated and special. The swans are stunning and Carole in the resturaunt is phenomenal. Overall great, except Keith.

Reviews.Title: “Central location for all things”
Reviews.Author: macdad25
Reviews.Content: Rooms are typical layout for Embassy Suites hotel. Feels up to date and very clean. Breakfast better than most E.S., very nice staff and nice grounds. Centrally located near frwy for easy access to all.

Reviews.Title: “Food location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Joebuyer
Reviews.Content: We are having a conference at this facility in 18 months. The rooms are in good condition but they will be remodeling starting November. I got a peak at what the new rooms will look like and you will nit be disappointed. Supposed to be finished by June 2012. Only one minor issue with room and that's the odd bathroom door - saloon style. This will be corrected with remodel. Site is adjacent to freeway so I dont recommend sleeping with window open if you are on that side of complex. As usual, stay comes with free cook to order breakfast and nightly happy hour. Both wine, beer and mixed drinks. Not downtown, but close. That can be good or bad depending on your preference. I look forward to coming back after they complete the renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, felt like a big motel trying to be a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Barbara111_11
Reviews.Content: Staff were helpful and cheerful, but the room was so very disappointing. Outdated dark colors, furniture, bad mattresses, slight, unpleasant smell when entering the main room to check in, the toilet in the room "heaved" for about 10 times after each flush. Definately would not return. The outdoor pond area was ok and I was pleasantly surprised to see a pair of white and black swans in the pond. The whole place felt old.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing spot, some glitches”
Reviews.Author: tjibbs
Reviews.Content: A very nice spot. I'm avoiding five stars for two reasons. 1) If you stay on the west side of the building, you're close to Hwy 29. Maybe it's just me, but while falling asleep wasn't an issue, getting back to sleep when I awoke around 5 or 6 AM was, due to the morning truck traffic. I wound up moving into the adjacent living room for the rest of the morning when that occurred. 2) And this was the first hotel I've been in for a while that charges for wireless. They do have a business center in the lobby one can use for free, though it's real hit-or-miss about how quickly the two computers are operating. Their maintenance and housekeeping staff are friendly, respectful, etc. Front desk staff depend on their mood, which is probably linked to how busy they are at any particular time. The continental breakfast is terrific, the outdoor courtyard a real nice atmosphere. Rooms were spacious enough for my needs. No water issues in bathroom, though the doors were a bit funky. This is NOT a quick ride to St. Helena, Santa Rosa, and the Upper Napa Valley, but there are still a ton of wineries w/i 30 minutes of this location, which--as I alluded to earlier--is very proximate to the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “OK but we expected great”
Reviews.Author: pawwap
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites Napa had many features that were very nice. The grounds were lovely, so well landscaped and cared for and the provided breakfast was superb The room was generous in size. But...there were a number of things that should have been far better. In our room, the bed was badly sprung on one side, and the room smelled strongly of some kind of cleaning fluid (smelled like vick's vapo rub to me). The doors into the bathroom were almost bizarre in their design as far as getting in and out and keeping them open. The daily charge of $10 internet connection should be part of what is included by 2011, as many cheaper chains do. I need that more than a phone for sure. There was also a charge for the daily USA today that had to be canceled if you didn't want to pay for it, once again complimentary in many hotels. We did not find the check in staff very friendly, and they acted like it was our fault that they had no reservation when in fact they desk person had just spelled the name incorrectly. Turns out when the name was entered correctly, there we were! So...this was an OK place to stay for our jumping off point to visit the Napa wine country, but I had expected better. I would not say, don't stay here by any means, but there are issues that should be addressed at the prices they are charging.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Embassy - clean,friendly,plenty of room and nice facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Jweimer1
Reviews.Content: We prefer to stay at Embassy suites because of the room layouts. We enjoy having a separate room for our son and plenty of room to layout all the bags and not trip. The linens and beds are very comfortable and neither one of us had a problem falling asleep after a few great days of touring around. We always look forward to the managers reception after a long day of driving too.

Reviews.Title: “Needs lots of TLC”
Reviews.Author: skwimmer
Reviews.Content: Came here to attend a memorial service for a relative. Had a suite at the back of the hotel, unfortunately close to Highway 29. The chairs in the room were too low and very uncomfortable. Suite was filled with over-sized stuffed upholstered furniture that was the wrong scale for the room. Wall outlets poorly placed and had to use an extension cord for computer. Pillows were squishy soft. Wood furniture all had sharp corners and was placed to bruise as many people as possible. They supplied a coffee grinder and whole beans (nice touch) but the beans were stale. The lamps were inadequate for any type of task lighting. There were rust rings around the base of the faucets. The sound proofing was poor. The outside walkways were not carpeted and you could hear every footfall. And, for a place that charges $310/day they should have included the Wi-Fi for free, not charged $9.95/day. Places that charge less than half as much per day give free Wi-Fi. Will look elsewhere the next time we are here.

Reviews.Title: “Third visit and we will return”
Reviews.Author: Sparky026
Reviews.Content: Was our 3rd time visiting the valley since 2007 and 3rd one week stay at this property. Very convieniently located if you're driving and downtown Napa is walking distance if you don't mind working off too much wine at dinner. Hotel prices in the valley are high, specially Yountville, we like to spend on dining, exploring & wine purchases so with time spent at hotel not significant we are looking for value and this one provides it in spades. Rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable, included breakfast and evening managers reception are a real bonus, staff (including maintenance) always smiling and helpful. Hotel grounds are great and it is evident a lot of time is spent keeping them up. Air conditioning in rooms is not great and maybe the addition of ceiling fans in the bedroom would help as most evenings and nights are cool anyway. Its not a five star but then you're not paying five star prices, has become our base when visiting Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “breath of fresh air hotel”
Reviews.Author: josiePlymouth
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Embassy suites hotel in napa valley and it was wonderful. a little more money than we wanted to spend but it was worth every penny...the flowers and waterfalls, and the swans floating around the pool was great. the full breakfast was one of the best we have ever had(included in room price). everything cooked fresh with plenty of seating for everyone.....at 5:30-7:30 its complementary drinks(wine,liquor etc.) with popcorn,salsa and chips, humus and bread...really a very nice hotel..also 1/2 off restaurant menu 4:30 to 6:30.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: lovdogs
Reviews.Content: The service is excellent, the free breakfast in the AM was better than expected. Very happy with the room, hotel staff service and the Manager of the hotel Keith is the best and yes we will return again. had a room viewing the pool very quiet room

Reviews.Title: “What a rip-off!!”
Reviews.Author: LoMerlin
Reviews.Content: Stay elsewhere!! - This hotel might - repeat - MIGHT - give you a good nightly rate - but will nickle and dime you to death on details - $9.95 PER DAY for wi-fi in your room - $7.95 for ONE cup of coffee other than at the breakfast bar - "Office Center" with a computer so slow I could have walked the papers there in less time - and the room air conditioner works in the "living room" section of your "suite" - but none filters into the bedroom. There were rude and unhelpful front desk clerks and personnel around the hotel. The only really friendly and nice folks I met were the custodians outside and maids cleaning the rooms -

Reviews.Title: “High Price, Pricey Internet Charges, and Poor A/C”
Reviews.Author: cajunpeggy
Reviews.Content: Our group booked 20 rooms. We had multiple comments about A/C not working (temperatures got up to 82-83 a couple of days), stuffy rooms, and noisy fans (ceiling fans and A/C fans). Guests couldn't open windows or doors due to traffic noise. Property is located next to Hwy 29. Internet charges of $10.95/day exhorbitant considering it costs the hotel virtually nothing and lower-priced properties offer free internet. Their business center PC's were atrociously out of date and slow; their internet connection is slow and several members of our party kept getting knocked off. We had talked to the hotel before booking our group and were assured that we wouldn't have these problems. The tour organizers stayed here a year ago and reported the same problems. We spoke to other groups who had stayed here and they had similar problems.

Reviews.Title: “I'll use my points elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: JoejElliott
Reviews.Content: I had to spend 50k Hilton Hhonora points for one night here (the Waldof-Astoria in NYC is 60k around Christmas) and I was disappointed. Despite my Diamod status and booking months in advance, we got a room facing the highway making for a loud night. The room is a decade overdue for a make-over and the AC didn't cool the room very well. Staff was friendly and free cooked to order breakfast is a good way to start a wine journey. For me, I'll save my Hilton points for NYC and stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Home Base for Touring Napa & Sonoma Valleys”
Reviews.Author: ExBuffaloian
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days (with 4 other couples) as a home base for touring the wineries and tasting along with taking the Napa Wine Train Tour and also an amazing experience at the Culiniary Institute (Greystone) in Sonoma (Kenwood). Our room was on the 3rd floor, consequenty very quiet with a beautiful view of the grounds. The staff was very helpful in getting wine coupons for us and making recommendations. The free breakfast was outstanding (awesome omelettes)and enjoyed the happy hour when we got back in time. The internet is free in the Business Center (either hooking up your own computer or using one of the 2 there. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great resting spot for Napa weekend”
Reviews.Author: kristine99
Reviews.Content: I visited Napa for a girls' weekend of wine tasting, and this hotel was a great pick! The beds are a bit small (two doubles), but the room otherwise accomodated five adults comfortably. The buffet breakfast was included and tasted outstanding. Additionally, I was impressed that the cooking stations were staffed appropriately for the extra-large crowd, allowing the line to move continuously. The hotel has a free happy hour daily offering drinks and light snacks, and they can be enjoyed inside or outside in the courtyard by a beautiful little pond with swans. It was a nice place to spend the evenings, and when it got chilly, the staff fired up the outdoor fireplaces. My only complaint would be no free internet: wi-fi or hard lined, not even free in the business center. Overall, a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great service, great free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: rend
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay, convenient access to the highway leading to Napa wineries. We have stayed at this hotel more than once and each time have had great service. The hotel staff are very helpful and friendly and gave us multiple free tastings in wine country. The breakfast buffet is plentiful and made to order, wide variety. The value of the breakfast makes the price of the room a great value considering food prices within wine country. Ask for a room overlooking the outdoor pond and/or outdoor swimming pool in the 3 story section.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: ktpylyp2
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stayed here recently and had a wonderful time. The suites were spacious and clean with two huge TVs. Happy hour and breakfast were both fantastic. Front desk staff was friendly and recommended a good place to go out late Sunday night (downtown joe's). We booked an awesome rate through priceline, but would definitely stay again, even if it meant a higher rate!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Free Breakfast & Happy Hour.”
Reviews.Author: loriann1957
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying for 3 days. Free breakfast & happy hour. Beautiful landscaping. Helpful and pleasant employees.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: Lauriee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for Valentine's Day, two nights. We were able to get a very good price off the internet, book early. Always consistent, friendly staff, great service, and a very nice location to stroll Napa, outlet shop, and wine taste. Considering the great rate, we definately were pleased. However, if you are looking for a high end hotel, best to pay a higher rate for one rather than complain after the fact. Hotel rooms are dated. The bed was clean and comfortable. Don't bother upgrading for a canopy bed type of room. The footboard of the bed just gets in the way. The room is not any different than a regular/standard room, just the boxey canopy bed. Just an FYI, the bathroom doors are two doors put in the space for one. Not sure why they don't put a regular door. The two are really just an inconvenience and awkward. Otherwise a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but dated”
Reviews.Author: Stano49
Reviews.Content: Nothing really wrong, but the facility is a bit dated. A makeover of the furnishings, rooms and public spaces is probably overdue. The bedding was excellent, the room was clean and the grounds were neat and clean, but the plumbing sounds came through the walls. Service was flawless.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty and good price but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Jilly_J_Bean
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because of price and location during a trip through wine country on our way further north. It has nice decor and both and indoor and outdoor pool. The pull out sofa bed was quite comfortable and we loved the kitchenette in our room. WiFi was NOT free (which is a shame in our day and age). The free breakfast was ok but we had to stand in line for hot food for almost half an hour (not really worth the wait). Also housekeeping came right before 8 am. That was VERY early for the day after Christmas! I could hear them banging on doors for half an hour! There were several noisy families late at night (I know that is no fault of the hotel) and someone was rolling a large bin up and down the hallway in the wee hours of the morning. Beware that some rooms face the freeway so if you are sensitive to any noise choose your room wisely. There are tons of chain hotels in Napa so I'd probably choose another one next time I'm going through town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Routine Travel”
Reviews.Author: GrabYourHat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of its proximity to a NYE party we were attending. The price was right, the grounds are lovely, the rooms are neat and clean and the morning cooked to order complimentary breakfast is great. The set-up is perfect for a family. The evening "Manager's Reception" was a nice open bar with chips and salsa and popcorn which I thought was a little tacky. I do like high end hotels so while this was perfect for a necessary overnight stay, I wouldn't consider it to "special occasion" worthy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: cantrav10
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I spent 2 nights at this hotel in early November while on our Honeymoon. The room was nice - large and well furnished. The bed was comforable. My complaints are only that the room smelled of cigarette smoke (even though it was a non-smoking room) and that the shower was too small. Their bathrooms could use upgrading. The location is excellent as a base for touring the Napa Valley. We enjoyed touring many of the local wineries, and loved the dining options. I highly recommend stopping by Fume Bistro and Morimoto in Napa for dinners. Incredible food experiences. The breakfast here was good - Just be aware it does get really busy the later in the morning that you go. Really, you pay to stay in Napa. Anywhere else, the room rate should have been a third of what we paid. Ultilmately can't help but feel we paid way too much for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Napa”
Reviews.Author: wardgarner
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I come to this hotel 2 -3 times a year, generally to take in a performance at the Napa Valley Opera House. This hotel has never disappointed. The staff are friendly, welcoming and most importantly, many of the staff have been there for years. The housekeeping staff is some of the best we have ever had. The on-site restaurant serves good food at reasonable prices. The breakfast is what you would expect at an Embassy Suites, always delicious. The evening reception is decent. They have both indoor and outdoor pools, so you can enjoy this hotel any time of the year. Our daughter always heads to the lagoon area first thing to "visit" with the pair of white swans and black swans. You don't need to be a wine drinker to enjoy Napa. There are many things to do in this area besides the "weekend wine tasting" routine.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be updated”
Reviews.Author: Fairlypicky
Reviews.Content: The location and room size are what is ideal. The 1985 decor can use some help. The indoor pool is cold, the hotel lacks any work out facility.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel that could be lots better but is well-located”
Reviews.Author: paris_1204
Reviews.Content: It's quite hard to give this hotel only 3*'s (Average) as it is one of the best hotels in the Napa area. True it's not in the heart of Napa yet it's right off Hwy. 29 which is very convenient. We stayed at the Embassy Suites Napa a few years ago, and decided to return due to having to use up airline points. We can't fault the staff as the front desk were efficient and helpful as were the breakfast attendants. However, the hotel room sure could use a major update. The decor is outdated, the sofa hasn't got much support, the shower and toilet are clean but need to be updated. Worse were the floppy bed pillows which frankly did not smell clean. Also the bathroom has just two tiny hooks attached to the door. There were no towel racks anywhere! They only provide a tiny hutch to place the clean, folded towels. Where do they expect the guests to do with them once they use them?? They could have attached some racks on the shower walls against the opposite side of the shower like many chain hotels do. It is very impractical and quite irritating to not have anything but those two itty bitty hooks. Speaking of the bathroom door it's weird. It's not a regular door but a swinging sort of door though it's complete. It's not appropriate. Thus, there is no lock on the door since it's in two pieces. Hopefully whomever you share the room with will not open the door on you accidentally. In addition, the rooms have very little insulation so one can hear the neighbors' noises from talking to slamming of their doors. The rooms we've had on both visits face the pool where the walkway to the rooms are wooden so when the guests walk and drag luggage on it the noise is quite apparent in the rooms. The windows facing the front of the hotel/street are thin and should really be replaced as the noise can be heard in the room. In short, this is a well-located hotel for the wine country and beyond, but it appears that the hotel management haven't made all that many updates over the years. And while the location is probably the main selling point for the hotel, they do charge some seriously high rates, and truly the hotel ought to make the necessary updates to justify charging so much and not rely on location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with a relaxing setting”
Reviews.Author: travelgogo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights-we enjoyed the relaxed and beautiful atmosphere of the lobby, the breakfast area, and the courtyard . The room was fine-i wish we had asked for a different room since we heard alot of freeway noise-but we got used to it - the breakfast was great, anything you could have wanted and included in the price. I would recommend this as a good choice in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites Napa”
Reviews.Author: Dancun
Reviews.Content: For Napa Valley, I dont think there is a better hotel.......When we checked in, David at the front office was nothing short of Excellent. I have NEVER met a front office worker with his AWESOME can-do attitude. We needed to change our room as we chked in due to freeway noise...called David, Room changed immediately. The day we chked in it was raining and cold, since the hotel was still in the fall mode (A/C only runs cold throughout the hotel until Nov) David IMMEDIATELY had a heater sent up to the room . We wanted recommendations for a good Italian restuarant...he got us reservations at Uva and at the mustard grill at the times we wanted.....This guy needs and award, SERIOUSLY...... My wife and I wanted a romantic getaway to Napa and we got it let me tell you. There is nothing like not having stress on a romantic vacation. Anyway, the hotel's breakfast is awesome as well....(dont forget to take ur breakfast coupons with you in the morning) or else you will have to hoof it back to the room to get 'em. The happy hour (managers coctail party) is also great with wine and your favorite licquors awailable from 5-7PM. This comes in handy after a long day of wine tasting etc.

Reviews.Title: “More than Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Baron45
Reviews.Content: Needed a room for one night and searched the various booking sites. Ended up using Priceline and got a room >50% off the hotel's website rate. Check-in was easy and quick. Room was spacious w/ living room and TV, kitchenette area (no stove) with microwave, sink, coffeemaker, & fridge. Bedroom had 2 queens but the mattresses were hard and had only one sheet and one thin blanket. Sleep quality was also hindered by loud plumbing noises from the pipes. Parking is free and so is the breakfast (omelette station) with self-serve drinks, cereal, toast, etc. Nice place and the courtyard has two ponds with water wheel and swans. Check-out was painless and took less than a minute. Good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RyanBrogan
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites is ideally located in Napa Valley, 30 minutes from the furthest wineries in Calistoga. It is only minutes to downtown dining in Napa. Hotel is very spacious and clean. Breakfast in the morning is a great added benefit as well as free cocktails in the evening. You can find cheaper hotels in the area but none, but we did see some of these and I would not skimp out. Embassy Suites is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: Factoryboy
Reviews.Content: Just one night here in August, which was perfect. Told them our trip to Cali was part of an anniversary celebration and they immediately upgraded us to a great room with a four poster bed, and then upgraded our two teenage boys to a suite as well! Very friendly staff, great location close to downtown Napa and close enough to all the vineyards, hacienda style (which was great because it kept the place nice and cool, and it was 111 degrees the day we were in Napa). Free cocktails at the managers reception. Good food in the restaurant. Black swans in the pond. What more could you want? I suppose the only downside was the very small swimming pool, but we found it perfect as base to do a quick explore of the Napa region. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: daisyatc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last October using my Hilton Honors points. It is a overall a nice hotel. The rooms did seem a bit small. The courtyard is beautiful. It was suprisingly quiet. Great proximity to Napa and Sonoma. The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean. My favorite part of this hotel is the breakfast and fresh cooked omlettes. I would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: lou11959
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at Embassy Suites in Napa. Rooms were large, bed was comfy and the courtyard was beautiful. Breakfast was excellent. The refreshments in the evening needed improvement but better than nothing at most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Staff needs a new attitude”
Reviews.Author: teemu99
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, with a good location, great breakfast and nice decor- however 3 things were an issue: 1) very rude staff with an attitude (what happened to hospitality). We checked in and asked for a king room. Attendant did not say no, so i assumed she gave us one. Found out it was a double. Rude Manager on Duty had an attitude when we asked to get a different room and made us walk all the way back to lobby with our luggage (long walk) before he would give us a new room. What happened to hospitality?? 2) Air conditioning was very poor. Would not cool the room, luckily it was somewhat cool outside. 3) NOISE- you can hear the cars no matter what side of hotel you are on. I sleep through a lot but could definitely hear the cars. Paper thin walls. 4) extremely slow internet in business center. Was this dial up??

Reviews.Title: “A nice little find and would defo stay again!”
Reviews.Author: missile
Reviews.Content: We booked this through an agent so I can't remember the price therefore can't really comment on value. However, on glancing at the Embassy Suites brochure, I did notice that this hotel seemed a lot more quirky than some of its more, shiny, new rothers and sisters. I am not quite sure where other people who have mnade negative comments have got them from, as we had nothing but an excellent expereince, with true american hospitality at its best! It was a very inviting entrance, immaculately clean and excellent service from the front desk staff. Nothing was too much trouble, from booking a restaurant (Celadon HIGHLY recommended to you!
