Its a 5min cab-ride downtown, but wonderful cuisine, not your typical American fayre!) The room was clean and spacious, with its seperate kitchen, living area, dining area, very impressed. The free drinks early evening (poss 6-7) was very well recieved by us (and many others). The breakfast was plentiful, constantly restocked and cooked option was avaliable if you didnt mind queuing for a few minutes. The swimming pools were a bit samll, although I didnt seen either indoor or outdoor even being used, so don't know how much of a probeln that would be. Well located just off the freeway, although a bit out of town, which was walking distance, although we didnt as didnt have time, a whislt stop overnight stay after a vineyard visit. All in all, very impressed so try it for yourself!!

Reviews.Title: “Good reasonable place in Napa.”
Reviews.Author: djlawman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Embassy Suites while on an extended California vacation, during which we wanted to tour Napa and stop in at our friend's winery (Frog's Leap -- a great winery). Stayed here with our two grown kids, and daughter's boyfriend, so we got two rooms. Front desk staff was extremely helpful on other restaurants in town. Rooms were comfortable -- beds were terrific. Pool was a nice way to relax and unwind, although water was a tad too warm even. Breakfast included was great -- the omelette staff here has to be seen -- they can really crank out a lot of breakfasts an hour. All in all, a very nice stay. Not the poshest or greatest stay we have ever had, just a good very serviceable hotel. And at a far more reasonable price than many of the much pricier places in Napa which we had looked at.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised it is certified as an Embassy Suite..damaged the brand name.”
Reviews.Author: vamonossf
Reviews.Content: If you are used to staying at a motel 6 you might enjoy your stay here. It is rather a motel than a hotel. It did not meet my expecations having stayed at other embassys suites properties. The first floor suite was small and cramped, giving one the illusion of being in a cave. The bathroom was small and had no regular door but a wooden folding door..maybe it used to be a closet . This property seems like it previously was a motel or an apartment and an effort was made to convert it to an embassy suite..an unsuccessful attempt indeed. Even though it is in Napa it leaves the lasting impression of a stay in a property outside of Fresno or Barstow. The front desk check in was impersonal and cold and very helpful. Pay a little more and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Good Location, Breakfast included!”
Reviews.Author: mishalin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Napa with some friends for a few days. For one, Napa isn't very cheep. We found that the Embassy Suites was in a great location for Napa, a drive back from wine tasting in the valley, but most affordable and clean. The front desk was very helpful when we needed to book some reservations, gave us great reccomendations and even called and made the reservations for us. We were surprised when we saw the breakfast. It wasn't your ordinary continental breakfast, they had a walk up counter to order omlettes of your choice. Also was a happy hour that started at 6pm to 8pm. So after wineries closed we could enjoy another cocktail at the hotel before we headed to dinner. I would say this was a great value, great location, clean and food was good. Oh and did I mention it was quiet inside the rooms. I couldn't hear the people above us, it was great. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location to wine country: Napa and Sonoma regions, nice rooms and clean.”
Reviews.Author: sjhowar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel using Hilton points for 5 nights. The location is excellent for access to Napa and Sonoma wineries. Ask for a room in the front of the hotel on the second or third floor to the left of the lobby. You do not want to be on the back of the hotel facing route 29 or on the right side due to crowds eating breakfast and. We also took a day trip to Point Reyes to break up the winery visits. I have stayed at several Embassy Suites in the past and they are very consistent. The room was excellent with a very nice bed and 2 flat screen TVs. We were disappointed in the free breakfast. My wife and I normally eat granola and yougurt for breakfast with fresh fruits. This hotel did not provide any of these items. The did provide grapefruit, banananas and apples. I have stayed at several chains which provide breakfast including Hampton Inn and Farfield Inn and they have always had yougut cups available. The manager reception was nothing to write home about. They provide nachos, salsa, bar snacks and popcorn. The drinks were watered down and the wine was cheap (especially after spending time at some of the worlds best wineries!). We did not stay at this location for the breakfast or the manager's reception, so I am not complaining. Just set your expectations! The hotel has an arrangement with a HealthQuest (a local health club) which is about 1.5 miles down the road. We really enjoyed the full service health club. This was a great benefit. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the property was clean. I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This is a terrific property.”
Reviews.Author: travellingsixpack
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found this property some years ago by wishing to use our Hilton points. We travelled with another couple. Everything about the property was wonderful. The location, the breakfast each morning, the Manager's reception each evening, the comfort of the rooms, etc. When we planned our next trip to Napa (May 2010), we were travelling with two other couples, making six of us. Our friends were very impressed with our selection and we all had a great stay. On both occasions, not only were my husband and I as the Hhonors members upgraded, but they were kind enough to upgrade our friends, as well. That was classy and much appreciated. The property is very close to downtown Napa and yet right off the highway. Very convenient. I recommend this property without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Free breakfast, Great Happy 2 hour.”
Reviews.Author: carletonsoccer
Reviews.Content: Easy off and off highway to visit wine country. Love the breakfast. Everything cooked to order and the price is right. After a long day touring wine country it was nice to sit and have a cold draft beer. Again the price was right. Whirlpool at 6AM was a great place to catch up with business back east. Very quiet at that time. Would strongly recommend this hotel. I would definetly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good for families - not for romance”
Reviews.Author: MomRocco
Reviews.Content: Okay, this is a nice Embassy Suites but the place was crawling with large families and some sort of conference when we stayed here. Our room had a view of the parking lot and about 50 years from Route 29 which is a highway and very noisy. The bed was comfortable and after midnight there is very little traffic on the highway. When we booked the hotel we thought it was nearer to the "downtown" area of Napa which it is not. However, it was convenient for getting to other locations in Napa Valley so that was a plus. We never went down to the manager's reception so I can't comment on that. The free breakfast was fine as long as you were ordering an omelet. I made the mistake of asking for one egg scrambled and got this weird thin omelet like thing which reminded me of the scraps of egg you scrape off your frying pan after making scrambled eggs. I was surprised that they still charge for internet at this hotel ($9.95 per day) as most hotels no longer charge for this. Housekeeping was a bit hit or miss on emptying the garbage and replacing towels. Our bathroom had two small, narrow, doors on it one of which was spring-loaded so that it remained closed. Because of the doors, getting in and out of the bathroom was difficult. Also the bathroom had no towel racks which seemed very poor design especially if you are asking guests to help conserve water by re-using their towels but then provide no way for them to let those towels dry out after being used. The outdoor area was very nice and included an area where a swans were swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Not Our Style”
Reviews.Author: Traveler8205
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the Embassy Suites Napa and checked out an hour later, after finding other accommodations. To the hotel's credit, they did not charge us for our one-hour stay. Based on TA reviews, I wasn't expecting a 5-star hotel and knew there would be highway noise. However, I was expecting a property that met the standards of other Embassy Suites. Our first floor room felt like a cave; the popcorn ceiling was very low, and there was almost no natural light. The decor and linens were extremely dated, and the bed and bathroom were small. After heading to the small pool and being greeted by a group of small children, we decided to leave. We headed to Napa for an adult getaway with comfortable accommodations. For only a small amount more, we found what we were looking for at the Harvest Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ohiochickGalena_Oh
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself has a lovely setting and we loved the courtyard, the black swans, etc. The breakfast was really good too. But, the rooms? Horrible. The water pressure was non-existant, the room is stuck in the 70's decor, the mattresses are old and like grandma's. It stunk really, really bad in the room too. We were very disappointed and shocked that an Embassy Suite looked so bad. This place needs a serious update and make-over. For the money, we will never consider staying here again! Never. I'd sleep in my car first!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AkronDeb
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! The scenery and landscaping are beautiful. The courtyard hosts a pond complete with watermill and ducks. As a visitor from the mid-west, I loved the outdoor living feel of the entire setting-- covered walkways between the buildings and eating areas in the courtyard. The breakfast was the best free one I've ever enjoyed complete with omelet bar, fresh pancakes, fresh fruit, and lots of seating. We had planned to stay only one night before moving onto our next destination, but we enjoyed the setting so much we stayed for a second night. Okay, here's the best part... the hotel arranged for an in-room massage. 90 minutes of pure relaxation! My family did not even mind me taking some personal time since they were able to enjoy the indoor pool during that time.

Reviews.Title: “$10 internet, $20 "Suite Tax" -- Stay Elsewhere!!”
Reviews.Author: DebIrene
Reviews.Content: The embassy suites looks nice for about 10 minutes, with swans in the back and a wide atrium. But after that, you realize that it is old and cheap. I was so taken aback at how dingy, nickle-dimesy and mediocre was this hotel that I'll never stay at Embassy Suites again after this -- I'll always associate it with cheapness and tack. If you're looking to book this hotel -- don't! Book Best Western Elm House Inn instead, several people we met stayed there and loved it. Or stay in St. Helena, Calistoga or in Sonoma at El Pueblo Inn -- no need to stay in the city of Napa. Pros: -- the breakfast is OK. It's an omelet. It's far from a great omelet or breakfast. It's just there and "free" unless you consider $30 per day for internet and taxes "free." The cook was nice, she was far more friendly than the hotel lobby staff. -- breakfast time, starts 6:30. My mom is an early riser, so this was great. Few other places have breakfasts served early. But then none of the wineries or shops open until 9/10am and there isn't much else to do. Cons: -- $10 wireless internet. That should be criminal to charge per room, after charging $180 already. They have a business center that has two old and slow computers, and charge per page printed. -- $4 bottle of water in the hotel room. -- $20 suite tax added to room along with CA Hotel Tax. -- None of the hotel staff was friendly or helpful with information about Napa. -- The "happy hour" drinks bartender didn't know how to make a Manhattan. They serve ONE wine in happy hour, in the middle of Napa, ONE wine, and it's a mass-distributed wine, nothing local or special. It's as if they're pretending they're not in Napa!! -- the room was terrible. The thermostat/air conditioner didn't work - we had it set to 68 but it was hot and stuffy most of the time. The showerhead attachment came out of the wall, the toilet handle was hanging out of the toilet. The shower had very little pressure and was just above luke-warm.

Reviews.Title: “Buyers Beware!”
Reviews.Author: rebeccaweir
Reviews.Content: We selected this Hilton Family Hotel for our 1st wedding anniversary because of its seemingly pretty grounds and large, suite-style rooms. What a mistake! The hotel was under construction while we were there, and large, loud, smelly diesel trucks constantly passed our room window. As they were repaving the parking lot, strong odors also abounded. The hotel is located right next to a major highway, so traffic noise kept us up all night long. The rooms were dark, dingy and very outdated for the price. The TV and other amenities were subpar. We called the front desk several times for more shampoo/conditioner, but they never arrived and we had to go to the grocery store down the street. As for the "pretty grounds", they were also under construction and were in total disarray. The waterways were empty and trash was strewn about. The hotel swans looked pitiful waddling around dirty puddles and work tools. We stay in Hilton Family Hotels frequently and were shocked by the dilapidated state of this Embassy Suites, and even more shocked by the price charged. If we could do it again, we would have stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn across town--its cheaper, quieter, and recently renovated!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Setting and really Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: MissKLS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in a suite on our tour of San Fran and Napa, we loved this hotel. Front desk staff were very friendly and the grounds are beautiful. The natural ponds with the swans were very pretty and I loved the gardens, especially the little herb gardens around the restaurant. My hubby and I are had cheese and crackers in the back little hidden courtyard, enjoyed a nice glass of wine at the managers reception and dinner in the hotels restaurant. We had a really nice breakfast and all the staff were friendly and very helpful. Our room was beautiful and I loved the bed! I already want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and rooms with free breakfast.. would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: LeezakFl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for three night in early April 2010. Everything went very smooth checking in and out, not problems there. The room was very clean, no problems there and the room was cleaned early every morning. While we went to breakfast our room was being cleaned all three days. The breakfast was pretty good with the usual Embassy Suites breakfast options. They had egg beaters if you want them, you just need to ask. We did not use either the outdoor or indoor pool, but they looked fine. We did see people cleaning and treating both several times during our stay. If you are looking for discounts on wine tasting, see the front desk, as they have a bunch of options for two for one and free tastings... The only draw back is that the hotel is not close to anything. You could walk to down town, but that would take 30 minutes or a $10 cab ride. I like to be able to walk around if needed... Overall, I would stay here again no problem. We stayed here using my free nights from the Hilton have a night on us promotion, so I can't comment on the the value vs dollars charged. Everyone at the hotel was cool and very helpful. You wont go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Reliable”
Reviews.Author: Preh
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean. A little over deodorarized but clean and comfortable. Rooms were spacious. Sink outside of the bathroom was a plus. Made to order omelettes were great. One tip - first night our room was on bottom floor. We could hear the people walking around at all hours. We switched to top floor and experience was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: got_to_see_it
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered a great ambiance, spacious suites, daily happy hour (as if were needed) and a great breakfast selection. I travel with work on a weekly basis and stay in Hilton products 99% of the time. This hotel is in the top 5 of the all the Hilton hotels that I have ever stayed in. This will be at the top of my list of potential hotels that I stay in on future visits to the Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Needs a Little Attention”
Reviews.Author: VenturaTraveler13
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location. Just off the main highway, a good jumping off point for the wine country. Overall, a good experience, with a couple of observations. First, the room to room noise level is annoying. I had to keep the radio or TV on to drown out the sneezing, coughing, conversation and TV from the next room, not to mention the mild roar of the fountains in the pool outside my room. I understand noise control is a problem in older buildings, but this needs some attention. Generally, staff was helpful. The restaurant was understaffed. It took 20 minutes to get a glass of wine. Food was OK, but priced on the high side. Breakfast was very good. The cook was quite willing to make eggs or omelettes to order. Overall, thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites, Napa California”
Reviews.Author: ShandaE
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites is always a great place to stay, and the one in Napa is one of the best. Great rooms, great breakfast, and a beautiful pond with swans right in the middle of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Napa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YoungDubFan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for staying in Napa. It was very close to down town Napa to take advantage of the tasting rooms and restaurants there. There was also easy access to get to the wineries in Napa. The breakfast each morning was great with made to order eggs, pancakes, cereal, pastries, etc. The reception each evening had the same wines both nights that we were there. The rooms are typical Embassy Suites rooms but were very clean and roomy. The hotel does not have great soundproofing and you could hear people walking along the outside corridors / balconies and it sounded as if we had a heard of elephants in the room above us. We could hear every step they took. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. The main negative was that the indoor pool had way tooo much chlorine.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoonyGermany
Reviews.Content: Nice but expensive hotel. The room was okay, the flair of the hotel was great. It has an great garden in the middle of the hotel, with many oppurtunities to sit around. Enjoyed the managers reception and the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Stay only for Business”
Reviews.Author: teatimeattorney
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here if you are looking for any kind of romance or glamour! I can see where the venue is good for the business seminar, but nothing more than that! It is located at the intersection of a very busy street and backs up to the freeway onramp. The lobby is pretty, but detached from the conference rooms, restaurant, and bar. The morning breakfast is okay for a basic start of the day, the service providers were very friendly! The front desk were not helpful... unable to give us information on where to take a run, and giving us wrong directions to get to a nearby town so we missed our dinner reservations. Overall, there's no reason outside of business to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great except for one thing”
Reviews.Author: JustPeg
Reviews.Content: this was my first time at an embassy suites. we used it as a transition hotel, into wine country, so we only stayed one night. the suite was lovely, with a real door to close off and all. we came in late at night, and left after breakfast. the pool and grounds looked nice. the included breakfast was not fancy or spectacular, but can do the job, especially if you have kids to feed. we would have loved it as a limited experience except for one glaring problem. the night was cold, down into the low 30's, and they TURNED OFF THE HEAT. my friend is very skinny, so she was very cold and called down to find out what the problem was and the staff member was not sympathetic at all and said that was the way they do it (turn off the heat at night) and offered to bring her more blankets. she should have taken the blankets, but for some reason didn't , and just suffered in the cold. I guess i was too tired to notice. The next day i had to ask if that was correct, i really could not believe they would do that. the guy at the front desk said they just had a problem with the heating system, so it went down. really sorry. hmmm. ok, but my friend was really put out at being treated badly, so she called the manager, who then said that, yes, they do turn the heat off. that is their policy. so the guy lied. I can understand it in the summer, when it is hot, and they may wish to save on energy and cost, but not when the weather turns this cold. needless to say, we could not go back there. Too bad, because everything else seemed fine.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: topper65
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of Embassy Suites because of their breakfasts and cocktail receptions and the ES Napa didn't disappoint. The facilities and grounds are beautiful and the hotel location is ideal. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for Napa Trip”
Reviews.Author: ohiojill
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent 4 nights here in Sept. We chose Embassy Suites because we had HHonors points to redeem, so we used points and had more money for wine! We were very pleased with all aspects of our stay. As HHonors Gold members, we asked for an upgrade and were given the "upgraded" room. It was basically the same as the one our friends were in, except for details such as artwork on the walls, etc. However, the management did leave a bottle of wine for us, which was quite nice. I would agree with the other reviews that you can hear noises from other rooms, such as water, etc., but it really didn't bother us much. The only real noise disturbance was from people that were loading their car and leaving at 5:30 am, outside our window. Nothing to be done about that. The room itself and the bed was extremely comfortable. We appreciated having 2 sinks-his and hers. As we were with friends on this trip, it was nice to have the living room area to meet and relax in. The breakfasts were very good as was the afternoon reception. My only comment would be that it would have been nice to have had some changes in the breakfast menu after a day or two. It was exactly the same all 4 days-although it was very good! There is a business center available to print off boarding passes and such for your trip home if needed. The staff was very helpful in recommending restaurants for dinner. We walked into Napa for dinner twice, as it was only about a 20 minute walk. The staff also was helpful in helping us arrange to have our wine shipped home-they work with a company close by, so we were able to leave our items at the front desk, and they arranged to have them packed and shipped. There are grocery stores nearby for items you may want to pick up for your room. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. It was a great "home base" for our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay - great breakfasts and evening receptions!”
Reviews.Author: JenPicks
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Embassy Suites Napa Valley while we were visiting Napa Valley for the first time. Great value especially since we booked the room through Hotwire. After our stay, I recommended the hotel to friends of ours that are visiting Napa over Thanksgiving. The suites were spacious and it was nice having an extra sink in the bedroom. The free made-to-order breakfasts were a great way to start the day and the evening receptions were a nice break between visiting wineries and dinner. We were able to walk to downtown Napa from the hotel for dinner one night. It was approximately a mile long walk through a residential area. We took a taxi back to the hotel and the fare was less than $10. The hotel's business center was helpful when we wanted to print out 2-for-1 coupons for the wineries.

Reviews.Title: “Very Romantic”
Reviews.Author: cmont1975
Reviews.Content: The hotel was only 2 floors high and had a cabin feel to it. The breakfast and happy hour was good as usual. The location was great! (next to a Coach purse outlet). There were lots of moms and pops eating spots around the hotel. I recommend RED ROCK barbecue. Wine tatsing everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Freebies are nice”
Reviews.Author: Lulu_Hutch
Reviews.Content: I had not stayed at an Embassy Suites before but was impressed with the hotel. Location was good. Room worked well for my dad and sister and I. And so nice to have a free breakfast that went well beyond the usual Continental and free happy hour. We were really pleased and it was a great home base from which to tour the wineries.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: crazedfortravel
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Rooms Beautiful and grounds are well maintained. Thought it might be noisy, close to busy road, but it wasn't at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value for Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel59
Reviews.Content: The hotel and rooms were nice. One of the nicest features is the courtyard with its pond and fountains. The rooms are a good size and the bed was very comfortable, but I thought the rooms were a bit dark. For the Napa Valley area, I thought the hotel was a good value for what you received. Breakfast in the morning and drinks in the evening were included in the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Three girls go to Napa”
Reviews.Author: Ann093
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful weekend in Napa with a couple of girlfriends and surprisingly it was cheaper for me to book Embassy Suites Napa from the UK. We had a third floor room overlooking the pool but the main bedroom overlooked the car park and there was a wee bit of traffic noise as we had the window open. If you have never stayed there, Embassy Suites give you a bedroom with two double beds and a living area with sofa bed, table and kitchen area so you can live quite comfortably in the suite. Every evening they hold a manager's reception with free drinks. We had a table outside next to their mini lake where two black and two white swans swam contentedly and enjoyed margaritas, wine and cosmopolitans (us, not the swans). The inclusive breakfast was excellent and the staff at the counter are very good and quick at producing lovely omelettes, bacon, eggs, hash browns etc. The sofa bed was amazingly comfortable and, being in the quieter room, was fought over on night two! Also, very close to the wineries which we enjoyed over the next couple of days and close to a grocery store for room supplies and the outlet village. The price was on the high side but I suppose they are covering the cost of our massive bar bill and lovely breakfast. Didn't use the outdoor or indoor pool but both looked inviting. Definitely a great place to stay for a convenient base for Napa wineries.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD”
Reviews.Author: jdiaz51
Reviews.Content: I read many disappointing reviews about this hotel, but not one was right, The hotel is clean, the staff is very friendly and recommended us great wineries. The Breakfast and Evening Reception were great too. Two pools, indoor is excellent Winwries must visit: Beringer and Merryville If you like italian food, try Uva Trattoria

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was almost a perfect fit for our trip!”
Reviews.Author: JamB57
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Embassy Suites Napa Valley because the location was perfect for our first anniversary trip to Napa Valley. We were also able to get some of our stay free with the use of our Hilton Honors points - which is always a bonus. Our check-in was smooth and we received the type of room in the location that we requested. If we could go back again, as many reviews have said, we would request a room at the front of the hotel as our room at the back of the hotel was very loud with the traffic from the highway. I thought of the TA reviews too late though and didn't want to cause a scene as I knew we'd only be in our room to sleep, shower and change. The rooms at the back of the hotel should have something extra to try and sound out some of this extra noise as I'm sure the hotel hears this same comment made often. The bed was comfy, breakfast was good and social hour was a great way to kick off our evenings. The two separate rooms were also very nice and allowed us to spread out comfortably. We would definatly stay at this hotel again and would recommend (and have recommended since we returned) this hotel to others who are traveling to the Napa area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Hotel, Great Concierge”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravelers
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Napa was over Labor Day Weekend. We arrived Fri about noon and were able to check into our room early (normal 4pm check in). Rooms are typical with front room with flat screen TV, couch, and table with 4 chairs; bar area with sink, refrigerator, and microwave; and back bedroom with vanity area and another flat screen TV. The bathroom was different having french doors, not a problem for us, but some don't like that they don't lock. They also have a little recycling bin in the room which was awesome, I'm a big recycler. We ate breakfast every morning at the hotel. They have a nice hot breakfast including choice of eggs, omelets, hashbrowns, bacon, sausage, and pancakes. I had a hot breakfast the first morning, but stuck with cereal, toast and fruit the other 2 mornings. They even had Kashi Heart to Heart cereal...score! Although I should have taken an extra box to save as they were out of it our last morning. We always got to breakfast by 9am and it wasn't that bad waiting for the hot food or finding a spot to sit. Make sure to visit the Concierge and ask about the wineries. We actually went to ask about shipping our wine back home that we bought in the Valley and he hooked us up with a bunch of free or 2 for 1 tasting tickets. The nice thing is that they don't expire, so we have some saved for our next trip. He marked a bunch of wineries on a map for us that he recommended. He also recommended buying some wines at JV warehouse in Napa to save money. We did found some wine there and were able to get it for a few dollars cheaper. However, some wineries only sell at the winery. Amenities included a nice indoor pool and hot tub. We went to the hot tub twice and it is nice and hot...103 degrees! I couldn't stay in it very long. There is also a small pool outside. They have a small "gift shop", but it's just a closet like room with a few toiletries. They charge about $10 for 24 hours of wi-fi if interested. Their reception at night was a big hit with everyone, but we didn't check it out. We were usually coming back from the wineries and getting ready for dinner at the time. There are also 4 swans that live at the hotel and can be seen in the courtyard or in the pond/fountain. So, yes, they will ship your wine home to you. We had them ship us our 6 bottles. You just turn in the bottles with a form (pick one up when you check in) and they pack it and ship it. We shipped regular ground for $20 and had our wine the Thurs of that week (we left on Mon). Looking at all states for 6 bottles, the average price is about $30 for ground, $60 for 3 day, $80 for 2 day, and $100 for next day. All in all, a great hotel with a very helpful concierge. We would definitely stay here again. Check out my profile for my Napa list if interested in our itinerary.

Reviews.Title: “Great setting”
Reviews.Author: jazz2006
Reviews.Content: Our trip was for leisure and when we checked in the clerk upgraded us to romantic room with our AAA card and the room was lovely and we enjoyed our visit very much. The breakfast was great and the setting was lovely and quaint and we enjoyed the hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: sharknes
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location and staff with a big room, the wine and olives during the afternoon was great. A decent location and nice grounds.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Los Gatos, CA - Northern California - Bay Area
Reviews.Title: “Very clean, very professional, great location, and great ambiance!”
Reviews.Author: afgam
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, there was a line of 10 people. I thought to myself, "Oh! No!". Well, it was all in the same party. Whew! From there, our room was upgraded. Katie, who helped with our check-in, was wonderful! It is only 3 stories tall. There's only one set of elevators. The hallways are short. We were facing the courtyard, "swan lake", and rose garden. Absolutely calming and wonderful. Our room was clean and lovely. I love the furniture and the chairs. The door to the bathroom slammed everytime that you opened or tried to close it. It's hard to explain, but that's the only issue that I found with our room. I was happy to see that we had fresh coffee beans and a coffee grinder. The coffee tasted better. The complimentary breakfast is normal. Also, the manager's reception was normal. A lot of room to sit down and enjoy your meal or drinks. One night, I ordered the Casear salad from Ring's restaurant. Wow! Love the dressing. Don't know what they put in it, but you should taste it. We really love the two tvs and the comfortable double beds. Lots of storage. Oh! I wanted the presidential suite, but no one available to tell me if I could get it or how much it was. I really wanted to move into there. Oh! Well, next time. Great location, near the outlets. Oh, they have two pools. One indoor and one is outdoor.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most beautiful Embassy Suites Hotels - great value if you go to Napa with familiy”
Reviews.Author: Sandokan62
Reviews.Content: this hotel is really very beautiful .. the staff friendly and you get a great value for your money. Clearly not the boutique hotel you might want to go to in Napa, but for a family the absolute best spot to be and visit Napa and the country side.

Reviews.Title: “One of the prettiest Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: t42
Reviews.Content: From the moment you drive into the circular drive fronting the hotel until the moment you walk through the lobby into the wonderful inner courtyard with its pool, pond, swans and baby ducks, this hotel will impress you with its landscaping and decoration. Our suite had a french balcony so we could leave the door open at night to take advantage of the cool evening air. The location next to highway 29 is handy for getting around but try not to get a suite on the highway side as traffic noise is noticeable. We switched our suite without problem and got one overlooking the pool on one side and the entrance way on the other. Also, try for a suite on the top floor so you don't hear people walking around, opening doors, etc. above you. We didn't find either the manager's reception or breakfast anything to get excited about, but it was certainly pleasant to eat outside by the pond. Also the pool could be bigger and have more chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Super Value”
Reviews.Author: Phangie
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal here from priceline and spent 4 days and 3 nights here right after the 4th of July holidays. The location was convenient, close to Hwy 29, although not really within walking distance from restaurants or entertainment that you would have staying in Calistoga. The room was clean, quiet, and the only thing that didn't work was the fridge. The free breakfast wasn't anything to rave about, but what it lacked in taste , it made up for in value by having one less meal to pay for in pricey Napa. There's a manager's reception each night serving free drinks, but we only took advantage of it once because free drinks = bad drinks. However, free also equals value and because of price + free value = I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Up-to-date rooms, Best Location & Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only 1.5 miles from downtown and few minutes from the wineries. The hotel grounds, reception, etc. are beautiful - this is not your typical business embassy. Hotel is built and decorated in napa style. The rooms are up-to-date, nicely decorated with armoire, plasma tv, large fluffy beds, etc. <I'm not sure what a previous reviewer was talking about with outdated furnishings or smoking). We had 3 ladies in the room (girls weekend winery trip) so the ad'l vanity and sink in the bedroom was convenient as well as the separate living room with table&chairs, bar, fridge, and another plasma tv. The breakfast was typical- eggs, bacon, breads, fruit, etc. however having breakfast on the patio in beautiful weather with swans swimming around was tranquil and picturesque. We had other friends staying at the meritage but it was 20min south of downtown napa and the wineries; it was facing an industrial park and expensive. If spending time at wineries or downtown then location is key -especially if using taxis/limos. From what i could tell, the majority of hotels are off/near the main road because there is only one main road. I never heard traffic and I'm a light sleeper but I always have earplugs and eyeshades. The hotel will pack and ship your wine to any state using 3rd party shipper and was less expensive to ship than wineries; plus some winery shippers could not ship to all states. Fun tip: we arrived at 2pm on first day, then taxi to downtown to purchase $20 tasting card next to visitor center and walked to 4 wineries before 5pm closing times and then stayed for thurs night's festival. 2nd day - limo to 5 wineries; highly recommend - grgich, *cakebread, *nickel, *robert synskey, chandone (*reserv required). Have a safe and fun trip :)

Reviews.Title: “For the price difficult to fault”
Reviews.Author: igga
Reviews.Content: Got a cheap deal through hotwire and were a bit unsure before we got there. However once we arrived these our fears dissolved. We got a clean large room on the bottom floor. Smashed the free booze during happy hour after a day at the local wineries. Got a great sleep and woke up to a good breakfast that was fresh and plentiful. Staff were friendly and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HazelEyesFromTN
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed a second time with Embassy Suites on this trip to CA and this time it was in beautiful Napa Valley. I will just list the pros and cons as I did with Seaside. Pros: excellent location to HWY 29 which is the main road through Napa, the continental breakfast was laid out like that at Seaside, a little all over but there was better seating and people could maneuver better to different food/drink stations. The omelet was delectable; the courtyard is really a site to see. My mom was taken in by it and our room overlooked it. Again, the room was spacious and clean and had a refrigerator. The staff was very friendly. Cons: the sofa was a rock! I really like relaxing and watching TV but I found it most undesirable and my mom was already in bed where the second TV was. The bathroom could use an extra hook for hanging a towel. No bellman EVER. Again, we are not in need of someone to drag our luggage to the room but opening a door would really be appreciated and is always a welcoming sign to guests staying at any hotel. I went back down to the desk at one point and found no one there so left after a while. We did eat the first night at the hotel restaurant RINGS because of our semi late arrival. It was edible and the server quite nice, but I would not eat there again. The trip was a late Mother’s Day present and she liked it so all in all I give this hotel a thumbs up because she was happy with it but I just can’t give it 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here anytime”
Reviews.Author: cosmicevil
Reviews.Content: I read the previous reviews on the this hotel and I was a little concerned. As soon as I walked it those concerns went away. The lobby was beautiful and the front desk staff was very attentive and helpful. We asked for a quite room and we were placed away from the freeway. The room was well decorated and clean. As for the breakfast, I thought it was great. There were many items to choose from if you did not want pancakes or eggs. I don't understand the other reviews. If you don't want breakfast, don't eat it, it's free!

Reviews.Title: “B-fast and Happy hour”
Reviews.Author: trvl2lv
Reviews.Content: sprawling hotel with several interconnected wings. The suites are spacious and recently renovated. The atrium is dated, as are all the common areas. Breakfast is not as good as in other Embassy Suites and the breakfast area was very crowded during my stay and it was difficult to find a table. Several breakfast items were missing and I was told that "maybe they will be available on another day"... Happy hour drinks are the usual fare and the same crowding problem.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, good location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ContinentalFA
Reviews.Content: As with all Embassy Suites, the rooms were large, clean and very comfortable. I requested a room on the first floor with a king bed, and the front desk was able to get me the room that wanted. Staff were all very friendly...provided great custome service. Asked for some winery recommendations and they happily provided us with some maps and two for one wine tasting coupons. The hotel grounds are beautiful. The live swans are a nice addition to the ambiance. However, the green dyed water in the "lake" is a bit over the top...a bit tacky. Breakfast in the morning was fresh, hot and delicious. The cooks were friendly too. The managers reception is always a nice touch at Emassy Suites, and was nice here too. Anyway, an overall great stay. Real short drive to downtown napa (no longer than 5 minutes) and close to tons of great wineries. The only negative coments is the fact that this hotel charges for internet in your room ($10.95 I think) -- free computer use in the business center. Also, there is not a gym on the hotel premises...although they provide you with a coupon for free entry to a nearby gym.

Reviews.Title: “Good and not so good.”
Reviews.Author: travlemore
Reviews.Content: At first they tried to charge me $239 per night, which for this hotel is way too expensive. I would not pay more than $189.00. The hotel was nice in the fact that there are 2 seperate rooms, a small living area with a very nice flat screen and a little kitchen area that came in very handy. The bedroom also had a nice flat screen. THey do charge $10.00 per day for internet, but have a business center in the lobby which you can use free of charge. We enjoy our morning workouts and there is no fitness center, but they do give free passes to the local gym which is a straight shot down the street from the hotel. There is also a free breakfast, which is very nice; omelets, fruits, pancakes, cereals, muffins bagels. Not just your ordinary continental. The rooms were ok, smelled a little funny and ours was very noisy (right next to the freeway). Not much to do right in the vicinity, but close to the interstate if you are going to do the winery thing. I guess I would recommend as long as you were getting a good deal and ask for a room away from the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay”
Reviews.Author: MidwestLiketoTravel
Reviews.Content: This motel was fine, but I expected more at a Hilton property in this neighborhood. Rooms were comfortable, but not spectacular. Bathroom was really small, and needs updating. Probably should have looked at HGI down the street as it is a newer property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good value, pools average, no onsite fitness center”
Reviews.Author: Bemore2
Reviews.Content: I needed to get away to some sunshine with my two kids during Spring break for 1 night and after reading the reviews here on TA decided to take a chance on the Napa Embassy Suites.Our executive level room was upgraded with iron-style beds, bedding ,dark tone furniture and was very nice (not the largest embassy rooms we have ever stayed in) As part of the executive package there was a chilled bottle of wine waiting in the fridge.(and of good quality , a nice surprise!) Beds are quite comfortable and the room is pretty clean. We were told the outdoor pool was closed upon arrival by the front desk clerk but another employee piped in and said it was now open. It was a small pool and not heated enough, also very dirty with leaves, as it had rained the day before. When we tried the indoor pool, it was better and adjoined by a "very hot "hot-tub. The outdoor grounds are pretty,but on day 1 the water area/fountains with swans were being repaired and it was noisy. It wrapped up by 5PM and then by morning the water re-filled and the landscape was beautiful again. The manager's reception served good cocktails(I was told) and the Cabernet I sampled was fine, not great, but better than I have had at other "free" servings. Chips/salsa/celery/carrots and fresh popped movie theater style popcorn were the snacks, the kids were happy with their slushes from the bar, as they had machines to form the base for daiquiris, etc.we ate dinner at the hotel restaurant and it was a bit overpriced and took 2 hours from beginning to end (not great with 2 young kids.) After inquiring, I found that the server (yes,there was just one!) was also delivering room service. How about some appropriate staffing??? The morning breakfast is traditional Embassy, omelettes to order, pancakes, cereals, fruit, it fit our needs just fine and we found a table after waiting just 1-2 minutes, wehad arrived for the last 1/2 hour of the serving time. I would recommend this hotel for the overall experience and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room! Nice pond! Horrible "buffet" breakfast, Mean omelette ladies!!”
Reviews.Author: Jules22228
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very beautiful!! Our room was vey nice, the beds are SUPER comfortable! You have to pay $10.00 for internet. However, the so called "free" buffet breakfast was bad.. very very bad, the omelets were terrible, flat, tasteless & nothing in them, when we asked for certain ingredients in our omelettes basically we got about a half a teaspoon of stuff and the ladies that make them were EXTRA rude. Either eat the fruit and cereal and do not have any interaction with the MEAN, hateful omelette ladies who clearly HATE thier job!! Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere to eat! Other than that the hotel is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: MaggieDublin
Reviews.Content: We just had a one night stay and really liked the hotel. The rooms are great with a bedroom and sitting room. Our room was in the couryard which is a lovely setting. The Manager has a free welcome drink for guests nightly which was a nice touch. As there is not much around the hotel within walking distance we decided to eat here and we were not disappointed. The standard of the food was really good and it was reasonably priced also. It was a Tuesday night and the bar and restaurant was fairly quiet. They had the TV on in the background and I asked them to put on American Idol which they happily did! (Apparently you can't get Fox in the room) My husband is not a huge fan so he went back to our room and I stayed watching it. The staff (in particular Anna) were great and looked after me as I was on my own and they made me feel very welcome. Breakfast was included in our rate and was excellent (buffet). All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friday the 13th”
Reviews.Author: McCaffrey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I met on a "Friday the 13th" and we try to get away to someplace nice on that weekend.After many hours of surfing the web,we picked ES Napa Valley.We arrived around noon and our room was ready.That was a great surprise.We went to our room to check out.The room itself was very nice and quit,but along way from the resturant,pool,spa.This weekend was very cold and wet.I called the front desk and asked for a room closer,they said"NO PROBLEM" but it was near the freeway.He would send someone up to our room to show us the other room.Manny Gonzales came to the room and showed us the other room.We took the new room.We came back after dinner at Rings to later find out MANNY had left us a bottle of wine.Thank you MANNY.On Saturday we spoke with Manny about wine tasting and he gave us alot of info on wineries.When we got back we found coffee beans and a grinder for fresh coffee.What a surprise.If all hotels had customer service like what MANNY GONZALES gives we enjoy our stays alot more.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel! So much fun!”
Reviews.Author: smieliczek
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel experiences. We came here after wine tasting for a huge family get together during the easter holiday. Free cooked to order breakfast in the morning. Free appetizers and cocktails in the evening. The hotel itself is beautiful inside and out. We sat outside next to the pond with swans and chatted with other friendly hotel stayers. The staff is super friendly. Great indoor pool and hottub. Great bar. Great rooms. Great everything! Loved it and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cherie078
Reviews.Content: When I got to the Embassy Suites, the room I got was right next to the freeway, and was a bit too loud for me. I called the front desk and they were more than willing to change my room to a more quiet area. My room was beautiful, quiet and very cozy. The atrium outside my room was so much better than I though it would be, they have real swans and ducks hanging out in the little river! I was so taken back by how gorgeous it was. I ordered room service for dinner, and have to admit that it wasn't the best, but it was ok. The breakfast however is really good! They advertise made to order breakfast which I figured would be just omelets or something along those lines, but it was pancakes, bacon, sausage, potatoes, eggs, omelets, and the normal stuff like muffins, fruit, bread, cereal and lots of other yummy stuff. I was so pleased that I had a REAL breakfast and it was really yummy. Everyone that I spoke to that worked at ES was really nice and pleasant. I would for sure stay here again without hesitation, and would recommend it to a friend as well.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: gone2bigsur
Reviews.Content: I was blown away at how nice, and comfortable, and beautiful this hotel was. I used Hilton Points to stay here and I would definitely return. The grounds are peaceful and there are lots of charming areas to sit outside and enjoy the garden. The breakfast was satisfactory (they have hot food served to order). The room was very comfortable and pleasing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: KatieB83
Reviews.Content: I was a bit weary at first to book our reservation at Embassy Suites since I usually don't like to stay at big chain hotels, but this hotel turned out to be gorgeous. The hotel itself is very clean and new-looking, and the grounds are very nicely done. Our room was huge, with a great sitting area and flat screen tv, a little kitchen with a mini-fridge, wine glasses, and corkscrew, and a big bathroom and bedroom. One of our favorite things about the hotel was the complimentary cocktail hour every evening from 5-7. Not only is it an open bar, but also they have little snacks and things to munch on. The outdoor pool is really small and most of the time was full of little kids, but the indoor pool was quiet and relaxing. The hotel was great and was a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: pool180
Reviews.Content: The region of Napa is truly something else. My wife and I stayed at the Embassy suites to celebrate our first Anniversary. Having stayed at several other Embassy suites we can honestly say that this property is just OK but won't blow your mind. People at the front desk were nice but to the point, just there to do their job but not going above and beyond, everyone failed to congratulate us on our anniversary even though it was on the reservation notes. As far as our stay we really enjoyed the complimentary breakfast, lots of variety and everything made to order, fresh with pleasant and attentive staff. The Restaurant on property disappointed, seems like it's stuck in the past with uninteresting appetizers not to mention the entrees. Servers at the restaurant as well as bartenders were very nice though. The room itself was tiny and a little bit rundown, if you have stayed at embassy before you will notice. Manager's reception? nothing crazy, but alcohol and chips! Whereas other Embassy suite hotels have ways better snacks and even tacos and nachos! To make reservations go to their website directly and pay in advance... you will save a lot of money!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TraceyJ1453
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. The hotel is a beautiful Tuscan design, with lots of courtyards, gardens and terracotta tiles. We stayed in the Winter, but I bet its lovely in the summertime. Our room was a very nice layout for a family of four with a bedroom and a living room with a pullout bed, there's also a nice little bar area in the room (well this is Napa!) We ate dinner and breakfast at the hotel and both were really good with great service. I am already planning a trip back to this place next summer!

Reviews.Title: “Oddly designed, but nice”
Reviews.Author: lv2trvlBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the week for a quick trip to Napa, rates were much better then. The hotel is conveniently located off 29 and within walking distance to downtown, the train even goes near it. The layout is odd as the rooms are surrounding an atrium and courtyard. We were half-way between elevators and did have to go outside to get to our room. Eventually we found the stairwell that made it easier to get to the atrium. The room is nice, typical of a hotel but with some nice decorations. The bed was comfortable but the pillows were too soft. The doors to the bathroom were odd as they pushed out into the hallway though not flush. The kitchenette area was fine; just a microwave sink and coffee maker. There was an abundance of glasses and mugs but no silverware or plates. Our room was above the atrium and we heard the noise during breakfast and dinner; it would have been loud for someone to sleep on the pull-out couch. We found the breakfast to be decent, it was only busy one day due to a conference. It had more than other free hotel breakfasts that I have been to. The wine reception was very good and they allowed us hang out a bit longer. I also noticed that the A/C was shut off and the room was stuffy. We blasted the fan and cracked open the window and it was fine. I am guessing that we were not near the highway since we did not hear much of that noise. The staff was fine though we had little interaction with them. This was a pretty hotel and the location was good for Napa-area activities. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1stNapatrip
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 days for a business trip. Check-in was slow and they did not have the room ready at 4.30 even though it was fully paid for a month back! A long queue formed while i waited for my suite to be ready and had i not stepped in to ask, i would have been waiting indefinitely. When i was finally assigned the room, the cleaner was surprised we showed up even though the room was not ready! The suite was nice and clean. Internet access is chargeable on a per day basis. Breakfast was delicious. Complimentary drinks in the evening was a plus. Overall a nice hotel to stay in, checkout a breeze since a bill is sent to my room on the morning i was checking out. Would have given it 5 stars, except that the check-in was a minus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodations... please eat elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: L-and-J-McSweeney
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites as part of a corporate meeting. The property is well-taken-care-of and the rooms are above average, although outdated. I believe the microwave in my room may have predated my own existance, but was still working after 30+ years. The made-to-order breakfast was decent but not above average. The conference meals were well below par and the reappearance of several dishes meal after meal was disheartening, to say the least. This may have been due to the package booked by my company, but was poor enough that I wouldn't consider dining in their restaurant on my own choice. All in all, if you are looking for a place to stay while wining and dining your way through Napa, this hotel would be a good fit. But please, don't eat here. There are many fabulous restaurants, bakeries, and cafes in Napa that would be a much better option for any meal.

Reviews.Title: “Might be out last time here”
Reviews.Author: VeelaVeela
Reviews.Content: I believe this was my third stay here at the Embassy Suites, Napa. This time, we were traveling with a small dog in tow. Upon arrival, there was a man complaining VERY loudly at the front desk. They self check-in kiosk was not working, so we couldn't avoid him. Because we booked a pet friendly room, we were relegated what apparantly used to be a storage room or broom closet. Hard, cold tile floors, low ceilings, and not a lot of elbow room. The bathroom? Ha. Microscopically small with pocket like doors. They left dog treats on the mini bar area for the pooch, and it wasn't until after I got into them that I saw a SMALL sticker that said $7.00. I've never seen that in all the places I've traveled with my dog. The good thing about the room location was that we were very near the dining area, so breakfast and cocktail hour were easily accessable. The courtyard is still gorgeous. The Good: Breakfast and cocktail hour included. Pet Friendly. General Location The Bad: Not enough tables for breakfast. Dungeon like room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at the Embassy”
Reviews.Author: Ingie179
Reviews.Content: So I read all of the reviews for this hotel and others before deciding to stick with this one only because my boyfriend had booked it already. I wasn't going in with high expectations needless to say. We stayed in what was called the Executive King suite. It was basically two small but sufficiently sized rooms with a dinette. The little refrigerator offered a complimentary bottle of Hess wine. Our room was on the second floor an the courtroom side with the staircase right behind our heads. The noise can be a factor here but it didn't really bother us too much and there was no noise at night or before 8 in the Am. I wasn't impressed at all by the buffet breakfast which others have said was amazing, the basic warming pancakes and french toast, cooked to order eggs, bacon/sausage...bagels, muffins(mini), juice, boxed cereal and coffee, eh. The grounds were great, awesome location, nice flat screen TV's, nice decor, comfy bed. Sucks that you have to pay for wi-fi but they have computers you can use. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No air”
Reviews.Author: linlo
Reviews.Content: This was my third time to stay here. I came with a group and the Embassy Suites was arranged through the trip coordinator. Last year we had a problem with the air conditioner in our room that never got remedied, but did get a box fan that helped a little bit. This year, same problem. Many people in our group complained about the a/c...the lowest setting you can put it on is 65, but in reality the thermostats are just decoration, and do nothing to cool the room. Finally we were told that they actually turn off the air conditioners at nine o'clock at night b/c some people get too cold. That's about the lamest thing I've ever heard. Obviously they turn off the a/c's to save money. My thought on that is if they can't afford to run the equipment, they shouldn't be offering the service. Interestingly, during our stay, they did go out and purchase more box fans for the "hot" customers (they ran out before...which speaks volumes for the situation). Other than sweltering, this is a nice place. Breakfast buffet is terrific.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: sam0z
Reviews.Content: Nice room, BEAUTIFUL center courtyard, incredible complimentary breakfast buffet!! I really loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: cydona46
Reviews.Content: I was concerned by some of the reviews had I read so I visited the hotel prior to making my reservation. I don't live that far from it (about 45 minutes) and I was meeting a great friend who was flying in from Georgia. She and I had a lot of catching up to do so I wanted to be sure our stay was up to par. It was! The staff from check in to check out were very efficicient and professional.. They were helpful and eager to make sure our stay was a pleasant one. Our third floor non smoking room (not a whiff of smoke) overlooked the pool, mill and beautiful swans. It was very relaxing and very quiet.The managers reception was very generous and the cooked to order breakfast was more than adequate. Did I mention the complimentary bottle of wine that was left in our refrigerator and the room service was to die for! I would definitely stay there again and I recommend it for all the reasons stated. Just make sure you specify the experience your hoping for.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Some quirks”
Reviews.Author: MFRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a quick weekend get away on points. Overall the hotel matches out to the prior reviews, and was a pleasant stay. This hotel is a good example of a unique item found in the Embassy Suites chain that I have not run into elsewhere. It appears to have been single’s apartments converted into a hotel. (Arizona has several Embassies like this) This has some good & bad points, the good is the grounds as noted, but the room layout is rather strange with a full sink in the bedroom with a full bathroom right outside the bedroom. And overall I’ve found this type to always be in average shape with some parts really needing updating. Furnishings were in good condition, but slightly dated and we have the brown shutter room so we got the one old, one new TV. And we had the strange dated bar/kitchen. Check in on a Saturday during the summer, expect delays getting your room as this place is busy. (Check in itself was quick) And get to breakfast early, it gets crowded by 9 AM but the staff in the kitchen is one of the fastest short order kitchens I’ve ever seen. We had a room facing one of the parking lots so noise wasn’t a problem, and overall the guests were pretty quiet when using the many outside areas for relaxing. But to get around the area & to get to dinner, it was great. For dinner, highly suggest Julia’s Kitchen at COPIA, we got a last minute table easily and it was much more of a local’s place without the HWY 29 crowd driving up the prices & the noise. Talking to the guys at Conn Creek, it was one of their fave’s as well for a nice dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Not really worth the money”
Reviews.Author: EmbassyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Embassy Suites and this one is very unique in it's design. The grounds are beautiful but much smaller than pictured. The mill wheel pictured does not move and is caged and covered in pigeon poo. The staff is wonderful, very friendly. Our biggest complaint was the noise. Do not book a room that is on the side against the freeway unless you are use to city noise. Rush hour starts around 4 a.m. and doesn't quit until after 9 p.m. They were also doing some light remodeling during our stay. Which we were not informed of until the night before. We received a note under our door informing us maintance would be entering our room between 10 a.m and 3 p.m. Luckly, we checked out before they arrived. Next time we go to Napa we will stay at a different Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: DCsCharles2007
Reviews.Content: I visited Napa Valley with my wife and another couple August 6th through the 9th. We were underwhelmed with the Embassy Suites. The location is OK. It's within a mile drive to downtown Napa and very convenient to wine country (i.e. close to 29 and Silverado Trail). The grounds are nice, but not spectacular. The small pond, frequently patroled by live-in black and white swans, is a nice feature. The pool is small and crowded. The atrium appears circa 1975, with outdated carpet and furnishings. Same with the rooms. The living room furniture must've come from the rent-to-own-collection - similar to what one may see in a "Roseanne" rerun or a trailor park in Arkansas. We were not impressed. The room felt dark, musty, and cold. The breakfasts were good - we really enjoyed the made-to-order omelettes and french toast. The afternoon snacks and wine were pretty nasty - not what you'd expect for $300/night close to wine country. More of what you'd expect on a red eye flight. The wine wasn't really drinkable. The customer service was laughable. The front desk is staffed with teenagers - way too cool for school. If you're a HiltonHonors member (I'm a diamond), do not expect to get any preferential treatment. Everyone is treated with the same level of mediocre, sometimes condescending, customer service. I'm very disappointed with Hilton and this property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sgsr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Embassy Suites 17th to 22nd August 2008, we loved the place. The suites were imaculate and spacious. The grounds were lovely and very well kept, excellent pool and well tended sun loungers and towels provided. The breakfast had a great selection and cooked to order although sometimes busy there was always plenty and you never felt rushed even at half past nine (this is when it finished Monday- Friday). The managers bar was from 5.30 till 7.30 and offered good quality wines from the local area along with various other refreshments. The staff were also very helpful especially Mike who delivered excellent advice regarding the local area. Lots of lovely restaurants in downtown Napa, Coles Chop House and its sister restaurant Celadon (at the top end) and also Alegria in the old bank building is excellent. For a more laid back informal dinner, you should try Downtown Joe's and Tuscany is also worth mentioning. Further afield Via Sutti Winery and Deli is well worth a visit around lunchtime and dont miss Mondavi and Beringer winery tours which are both excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: jssss
Reviews.Content: I do not see what the big deal about this place is. After reading the reviews here I thought it would be better than the average Embassy Suites--it is not! The hotel's web site says all suites are full renovated. Well I guess that depends on what you call fully renovated. By looking at the exterior of the rooms from the balcony it appears that there are two distinct room sets at this location. The rooms that had dark wood shutters fronting the balconies appeared to have LCD tv’s in the front living space besides a rather 3rd rate lcd tv in the bedrooms. The rooms that had beige shutters had lcd tv’s in the bedrooms but older crt models in the living space. As for my room it did have what appeared to be a newer couch, and chairs but the rest of place looked run down. The vanity had a big crack running through it. The kitchen (or whatever you want to call it) had a 1990's vintage microwave and mini frig. None of the phones in the room worked. Aside from the conditon of the interior of the room we had one other issue: The front door of the first suite we were given had an almost 1 " gap between the door and door frame at the bottom of the door. Seeing as the front door was an exterior (picture old 1960's Holiday Inn style) door --this is not good. Besides letting in light just about any bug you could name could have come in the room and this is exactly what happened. We noticed this and were given another suite--which I noticed was only slighly better with a 1/4" gap at the bottom of the door. If you need to do any work forget it unless your laptop battery is fully charged. There were no desks, just a table in the front room, but with no available plugs to use at the table. Bottom line—nothing special here at all. Just a run of the mill Embassy Suites property with slighly above average grounds.

Reviews.Title: “paper thin walls, sounds like water pouring down walls when toilet above flushes”
Reviews.Author: pmbee
Reviews.Content: We were booked at the Marriott and they bumped us and put us up at the Embassy suites. If you arrive as a walk over from another property you are given the room in the back corner on the first floor along the highway. Thr room had a handicap shower only. We were fortunate not to have an amorous couple above because we could hear everything! and when they flushed the toilet it sounded as if water was running down the wall. do not let them put you in room 121. Our friends stayed on the second floor. it was even noisier. 2 car alarms went off during the night due to the traffic noise on the freeway off ramp right along the hotel building. The breakfast is generous and the pool nice, but we did not sleep well and cannot recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites in Napa”
Reviews.Author: princesscel
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Numerous Embassy Suites through out the Country and have always enjoyed our stay. When we decided to go to Napa, we didn't even think twice about staying in Embassy. First the price was too extreme, once we got there the hotel was fairly small only 3 stories. The rooms were the smallest rooms we had ever been in while staying at the Embassy Suites. The sofa was oily and greasy, didn't even like sitting on it with out feeling dirty. the bathroom was tiny, our keys kept getting demagnitized by just being in our purses or wallets made several trips a day to the front desk to get the keys fixed. We did enjoy the complimentary cooked to order breakfast, but both days the staff yelled while taking your orders, they were not the friendliest staff members. Definately wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: sandalsnosox
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay of 2 nights. The grounds are beautiful, the front desk staff both friendly and very helpful. The rooms are spacious and clean. They have both an indoor and outdoor pool - great for relaxing in after a day of touring Napa (which is gorgeous). I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Second time around at the Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: pinaykat
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites in Napa is a really nice time. I've stayed there twice, the first time for pleasure, and this time for business. The room definitely has a lot of perks. It was nice having a table in the living room, the bar, refridgerator, and microwave. There was also a sink in the bar area. The bathroom was typical, although it was a little strange how the two doors opened outward. The room was really comfortable and it was also great to have a sink in the bedroom as well. The location of our training was spacious, the courtyard and swans were a great touch, and so were the free breakfast and 2 hour cocktail hour. The only downside is that there is no gym onsite.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the average Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: layla207
Reviews.Content: We like Embassy Suites and stay at them a lot. But this one was definitely prettier and nicer than average. It was infused with the feel of Napa Valley. The location was nice, too. It was close to the highway but also close to town. Service was good, staff was helpful. They arranged for some of the various wines we bought to be shipped back home.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with kids”
Reviews.Author: BaliHoliday
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this hotel and would say that it made our whole visit to the Napa very memorable. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and very convenient with 2 young children, aged 3 and 6. We booked a 1 bedroom suite with 2 double beds and separate living room which allowed us to stay up after the kids had gone to bed. We reserved a room on the 3rd floor after reading some reviews about noise and did not have any problems. The hotel had a lovely ambience with the outdoor courtyard, water feature and swans which the kids particularly enjoyed as well as the 2 swimming pools which we made the most of. Both the breakfast and manager's reception (free drinks and nibbles) were great. Highly recommend staying here if you have children and also highly recommend the Wine Train Family Night. Our girls enjoyed this immensely, our food was delicious and the whole experience worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alleycatD
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy staying at the Embassy Suites in Napa when I need a one night vacation. It is located conveniently close to the freeway and easy to find. The staff is friendly and check-in is quick. The grounds are spectacular with a mini waterfall and black and white swans. The rooms are spaciaous and beautiful with a sink, microwave and a refrigerator. Also, the lodgenet system has a large selection of available video games. The only problem I had during this stay was with the plumbing. In the morning the drain in the bathtub started backing up and filling the tub with water filled with large black flakes. (I hadn't even used the shower yet. It just started backing up on its own) After a minute or so the water drained back out of the tub and there were just dozens of little black flakes sitting in the bathtub. Aside from the plumbing problem I had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bandit
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Embasy Suites Napa. Got the "romantic suite" with beautiful and comfortable four poster bed, nice furniture - with flat screen tv in living area. They have two pools - an outdoor pool and an indoor pool - along with a very nice indoor hot tub. Sauna was nice too. Had a full size coffeepot, coffee beans and grinder for great coffee! Also had a complimentary bottle of wine in the refrigerator!! The grounds and gardens are absolutely beautiful. It seems more like you are out in the country, not close to the highway! Breakfast in the morning is great with just about anything you might want. The evening manager's reception offers free drinks (wine, mixed drinks, beer and soft drinks) along with chips and salsa. Although there is a charge for wireless in the room, there is a business center with free internet and printers in the lobby. I don't think we could have picked a more beautiful and comfortable location for our trip to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back for more...”
Reviews.Author: jch2000
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Our check-in was smooth, the rooms were clean & comfortable and the grounds are Exquisite. I have rarely stayed at a more scenic hotel than this. I will return whenever I am in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Bumpy Checkin with Ryan”
Reviews.Author: Likeness
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our first night with Hilton Honors points and paid for an additional two nights. We arrived an hour early and Ryan, the person that checked us in told us that our room was not ready. It was 3:00pm. He asked us to wait an hour and our room would be ready at 4:00 which was checkin time. In all my years of being a Hilton Honors VIP, I have never been asked to wait, but decided to wait patiently because Ryan said we would have a really nice room. When we went back to check in at 4:00pm, Ryan gave us the keys to our room and we decided to check on it before we brought our bags up. Being on a two week trip, we had lots of bags. The room he gave us was back in a corner of the property with no view. In fact the windows faced the noisey freeway. So, we went back downstairs and requested a room on the front of the property which would be quieter and have a nicer view. He told me that there was nothing in the area that we requested. After telling him that I didn't even want to stay in the hotel, he went in the back and came back with keys to a room in the area that we requested. This is the first time I had ever had trouble getting a nice room. Despite our problems with Ryan, the other staff in the hotel provided excellent service. We had trouble on the 2nd day getting our keys to work and we were told that Ryan did not fix them where they would work more than one day. The man at the desk fixed them and assured us they would work for the remainder of our stay and they did. We ate one night in the hotel at Rings and our waiter was fantastic, as was the food. Our room was very nice, extremely clean. I always love their beds. The TV's were very old though and needed to be replaced as the one in the bedroom did not work. The AC did not work. This hotel is very convenient to everything in Napa and even Sonoma is a short drive. There is an Italian deli, Genova, that is on the way to Napa wineries. Stop and get you a sandwich, sides and a drink to take with you. Some of the wineries have picnic areas and it's nice to eat there. The food at this deli is fabulous!! You may have to wait a bit, but take a number and it goes pretty fast and is well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: n6877
Reviews.Content: what a great place! not you typical embassy but very nice swans and ducks in the outside ponds! Very quite because of the interior style rooms

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel to use as a base”
Reviews.Author: TonyCi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five days when visiting Napa for a wedding . We found the rooms spotless and clean - the gardens were particularily well thought out and looked after. The restaurant was extremely good as were the breakfasts , though as mentioned before , it is best to eat early. A simple free tram/bus ride gets you into Napa town and is reasonably easy to use , once you find the stop about 80yds down the road .. We had a great time at this place and would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: ZaraWesternCanada
Reviews.Content: Great rooms at this hotel. Newly renovated suites. Bottle of wine, coffee beans and grinder, full sized coffee pots, great wine glasses, flat screen TV. Pull out sofa bed in living room was actually comfortable. Bedroom was lovely with great bedding and comfortable mattress. Very clean rooms and grounds. Courtyard was pretty with outdoor pool (not open) and on one end a pond with swans. Lots of benches around for catching sun. Our room was in the quieter area with a fountain outside. Indoor pool and hot tub as well as the outdoor pool. Full breakfasts included in the rate. Pay for use wireless in rooms, but rates were less expensive than in San Francisco hotels. Could have used a concierge as check- in staff couldn't help with a restaurant or even to order pizza. Staff were all polite and service oriented.
