Location isn't great for views but easily accessed just off the freeway and close to a designer discount mall. Some rooms would be noisy just off the freeway. Suggest you avoid them. Walkways to rooms are outside but covered and inside the courtyard. Could be a problem in a hard rain. Overall would stay again. Ate at a restaurant Celedon. Was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!”
Reviews.Author: as9ae
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a great time at this hotel. Our room was large with a fridge, separate living room, and bedroom. We took full advantage of the happy hour. They had free drinks and a wide selection, as well as veggies and chips and salsa. They had a free breakfast, including omlets, yogurt, fresh fruit, etc. There was definitely a wide food selection.The hot tub was fantastic, as was the pool! The place was quiet and clean and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We never got a chance to check out the restaurant inside. Admittedly, the decor outside of the rooms was a bit cheesy (although the lobby and rooms were nice). It may need to be updated. Children would enjoy the courtyard with the swans and old mill with water. Overall, the perks were amazing and we defintely got a great deal!!! I'm not sure it was the most romantic of getaways but it was a great and affordable place in a good location. This would be a great place for a couple of friends that decide to check on the wineries.....If you're looking for romance, it may not be your spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Families”
Reviews.Author: kved
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for families. We have a 10 y/o and 3 y/o, the rooms are spacious. Breakfast in the mornings are great, lots of variety and good quality. The staff is friendly and is more than willing to accomidiate your needs. The landscaping is great, nice seating area near the pond and mini river with swans, ducks and koi. We went to the managers reception each night, selection of snacks was okay...the open bar was great! The kids enjoyed the swans and ducks as we had a few cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: tiktok9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property on a Sunday and Monday for a Diversity conference sponsored by my university. As I drove up to the hotel, it didn't seem that nice. The location is right off the freeway, and I've seen Embassy Suites with better exteriors. I was really surprised when I stepped inside. It seems like a different world! It got better as I walked to the atrium and the conference area. The outdoor pond and watermill had a lovely ambiance and relaxing sound. The conference rooms were nice and the staff members were friendly. I was not wowed by my room. I was in the wing closest to the freeway, on the ground floor. It was dark and gloomy in the room, even though we opened the shades. The furniture/beds were nice enough, with a French country-type style, but not as nice as other properties. It was nice to have a vanity outside of the bathroom so we could get ready faster - but it was kind of weird having it right next to the TV. The beds themselves were comfy enough - but anything would have worked for me after supervising a group of college students at the conference. I only had 2 negative comments: When I walked by the ponds (where the geese & ducks were), there was a terrible sewage-type smell, which disappeared once you went into the buildings. The other bad thing was a loud security alarm (not sure where it was coming from) going off for more than an hour. I wasn't sure if it was on the property or across the street. I just wished someone would have found it earlier to turn it off! I guess this showed how thin the walls were - I could also hear street traffic throughout the night. You should request a room further away from the street and on an upper floor. Breakfast was plentiful, with made to order omelettes, bacon, sausage, pancakes, oatmeal plus other items like bagels, cereal, fruit, etc. Like other reviewers have said, the location is great - right off the freeway & within 2 minutes of the Napa outlets. That being said, overall, I had a positive experience here and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Customer Service Oriented”
Reviews.Author: countessjc
Reviews.Content: Although I have Diamond status with Hilton, the young man at the desk assigned us to one of the worst rooms. It was in a dark alley and did not overlook the lovely grounds. Brian was less than axccomodating when I requested a room overlooking the atrium, but finally after a wait assigned us to a better room.. I inadvertently left a folder with my confirmation for the Napa Wine Train in the breakfast area and asked if anyone had found it. I was sent back to the area and no one was there. My second request was essentially met with , I don't know and I don't care. After 3 more attempts over my 2 day stay with no help from anyone at the front desk, the resaturant manager found it in the trash. It was most discouraging that no one at the front desk made any effort to call , but sent me hither and yon. No one seemed concerned or demonstrated the slightest degree of helpfulness other than the Restaurant Manager whom I finally located on the second day. The location is good, but Embassy Suites typically have dark, rather depressing rooms and this was no exception. The Manager's Reception was generous, but the bartender was also less than friendly or pleasant. This property could benefit from staff training in customer relations and with supervision.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Napa”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGirl78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my fiance using Hilton points back in October 2007. This was the second time that we have stayed at this hotel, and have not been disappointed. It is a nice property, true to the local architectural flavor - not like the typical Embassy Suites that you think of in downtowns. Nice charming courtyard, free buffet breakfast, helpful staff...would definitely recommend, especially if using points. With points, we got a 2-room king romantic suite. Really cute with 4-post canopy bed, nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: stayformillionyears
Reviews.Content: Thank you to those who left such detailed reviews prior - really helpful so I must give back as well. We went day after xmas 2007 - family of 5, my wife, sons age 10,8 and 5. We had a wonderful time. Here are my tips: 1. The morning breakfast was great - make sure you eat before 830am or it's a cattle call situation. 2. The kids really loved the indoor pool - great size and the jacuzzi was nice - well lit so you feel energized. 3. Manager's reception - great - you can get drink after drink - all complimentary alcohol, soda, everything. 4. Rooms were excellent - lots of space, nice fridge, sink and microwave, good bathroom - excellent cleaning persons - we tipped them they were so good - Flatscreen TV and tv in back room. 5. Peaceful scenery with the atrium, and courtyard garden and geese. The atrium also has a nice bar and social room - lot of parties were going on there. 6. For outings I recommend going to: -Copia (great for kids, nice museum and they took you on tour - only cost $5 per adult, children free) -Sweetie Pie's and General store in Downtown Napa - nice location and right on the river - great friendly service and good prices. -for elegant night dinner - Giovanni's was really good - should call for reservation as it seemed really crowded. -Loved Cakebread Winery - Friendly people and wine tasting only $10 per adult - nice tour as well. - Playground Fantastico - right across the hotel on other side of freeway - kids loved it - really big and modern playground. - Premium outlets - great stores my wife stayed 3 hours at a time for 2 days shopping there! -Dean and Deluica - wife loved the baguettes there. 7. I would not recommend: - Visatui Winery - people not friendly at all - no tour and the hype does not match the experience. - hwy 29 very dangerous road, hard to cross, no stop signs or lights and many cars - very difficult to change directions on the road- have to wait and then really make your move sometimes. - did not like parts of downtown napa like 3rd street - homeless people and little bit defense antenna went up there waiting for burgers at Nations - the burgers were good though! overall great vacation and kids loved it too.....embassy suites had a lot of people there - the noise of people walking up above you and on the walkways was loud but you will get your money's worth - good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Embassy Suites....not sure about the hype”
Reviews.Author: LQGuy
Reviews.Content: After reading the many reviews here, I was expecting an extraordinary Embassy Suites property. Here's my take on this particular hotel... The grounds are very nice for an Embassy Suites. Nothing spectacular, but a nice outdoor atrium instead of the usual indoor one. Small water features and animals were present. The room was simply a typical Embassy Suites room. No ifs, ands, or buts about it. Nothing worse than a typical Embassy Suites...but nothing better either. The bed was okay. We both didn't sleep so great on it. But it wasn't a horrible bed. Breakfast was simply a zoo! We had to wait in line for approximately 20-25 minutes, and then there were absolutely no tables available, so we had to take it up to the room, then return for juice. Breakfast was okay...about on par with Denny's calibar food. Not horrible, but certainly not gourmet. Again...typical Embassy Suites. Would I return to this hotel...probably! If an equally or higher rated hotel were available, I think I might go try it before staying here. Again, there is nothing wrong with this place. I'm just not understanding what the hype is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time !!”
Reviews.Author: mjbot
Reviews.Content: First time in California and we had a geat time!! Hotel was beautiful, clean and central to everything. Yes, the bathroom doors were really weird but who cares. Our bed was soft and quiet. We did ask for the 3rd floor due to earlier reviews. All was good. We loved the lobby, get your wine at the managers reception and turn the chairs by the fire around and enjoy!! We watched the Steeler game last Monday in the bar, on really comfy couches. Almost as good as home!! What a mess the Monday night game was!! We are from Pittsburgh so guess why we picked CA for a few days?? The managers reception is nice, food got a little boring but is free(well, included in your price). Mike, who is a bartender for the 2 hours while you are there is really nice. We tipped him well and he kept the wine and drinks flowing!! You can sit inside in the Atrium but since we are from the North we enjoyed sitting outside. The did not have the Chimneas lit ,but I bet if we would of asked the would have!! We did sit at the fire, as I said above. David at the front desk was very helpful, as seen in above reviews. He helped us plan a few days and we got in all that we wanted to see. It was crazy but this was a sightseeing vacation not our usual beach vacation. What I really liked was David remembered us and what we did for the day. What a personal touch!! That made us feel special. When can you say that about a hotel?? He was great. They have comment cards and we filled one out for both Mike and Dave, I hope they got them. Dave, if you are reading this after we told you about this web site please accept our thanks. We were told to go to Bogeta Bay by Mike. What a beautiful drive through wine country. Carols Pizza Shack was recomended if you are staying in. It was really good. Route 1 was beautiful but were are the guard rails???? I was totally freaked out. Now I know what "breathtaking" scenery really is!!!! Fishermans Warlf was okay if you like the tourist thing. We didnt. My husband is still complaining about the $7.50 ice cream at the chocolate place, not worth the price. Did the wine train, wonderful!!! We did the lunch beacause the Moon light dinner we first booked was not full. I would recomend doing dinner if you want a more romantic setting. Lunch was romantic but if we go back I would do dinner. I hope this helps ,do it all while you are there.!! We did ,from the wineries all the way to San Fran. Have a blast and remember life is short!! I forgot,. breakfast is wonderful you can eat what you want and switch it up everyday if you want. Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Emabssy Suites”
Reviews.Author: Butrfli1227
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend at the Embassy Suites. It is a very nice hotel with a great location. It's at the southern end of wine country right by the highway which makes very easy to tour the valley. They have a pretty courtyard area with lots of tables and chairs to relax. It would have been nice if maybe they had a few extra heaters so you could sit outside at night and enjoy the fall air. The other common areas are good too, they have a very expansive property. The rooms were nice, I always like the suites at this hotel. It could definietly use an update though. Beds were pretty good and there were never any noice problems. But there was a very gross looking stain on one of the chairs...i'm suprised they didn't clean it off. The free breakfast was really good! Pancakes always tasted fresh and they always had crispy bacon. The cocktail hour was also good, with wine & liquor, and cheese, crackers, chips and veggies. Overall it was a great stay and I would definietly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome at the Embassy”
Reviews.Author: eastcoNc
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful wine country vacation with our daughter and her husband feeling as though we have left a family member behind. I'm speaking of a hotel employee by the name of David Grenada whom I can't say enough of good things about. He made our trip so very special in so many ways. Without his expertise advice and helpfulness, we wouldn't have known what our best options were. Everything about the hotel was great! The grounds are landscaped beautifully with a pond featuring a fountain,a waterwheel and graceful swans swimming daily. The architecture of the hotel is lovely. We started each morning with a plentiful breakfast with anything from a made to order omelette with a side of bacon or sausage, to fruits, yogurt, & cereals. Our room had been recently renovated to the highest quality anywhere from granite countertops to flat screen tvs. Everything was very accomodating and clean. The hotel is located near downtown close to several fantastic restaurants. Of course, David recommended these to us and even made our reservations. Everything was FANTASTIC!! Great Food, Great Wine, Great New Friends. We will definitely visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but walls are thin!!!”
Reviews.Author: linda_derek
Reviews.Content: I agree with other posters that the hotel has nice grounds - looked upscale from the outside, nice courtyards, etc. We might have gotten one of the reno'd room 'coz the furnishings were nice inside too. The gift shop has closed down so it looked funny in an otherwise nice reception/foyer area - you see something that's gone out of business when you first get there to check in. Unfortunately, the walls were THIN. VERY THIN. My husband was on the couch in the living room and the noise from the fountain in the courtyard kept him awake. We can hear people walking in their room upstairs, can hear people walking outside on the corridors, can hear bathroom in use next door. Which is too bad given what the hotel could have been. Nice showerhead, but installed at 5'11" height..so better than the one we had at Best Western the night before (it was installed at 5'9" height) but still ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Embassy, but stay on the 3rd Floor!”
Reviews.Author: Nicmacco
Reviews.Content: We used points for our stay for two nights Oct 26-28th, so that was great. My inlaws tried to book as well, couldn't use their points and ended up having to pay $280 per night! That is a lot for an Embassy! But, this was seriously the nicest Embassy we ever stayed at because the grounds & service were great. Ideal if you are going with a group of friends having to share accommodations, or bringing a child. I was blown away by the swans, flower gardens, indoor/outdoor pools, huge bar, restaurant, lots of meeting space. Plus, we recieved a rennovated room which meant all up to date furnishings (pretty mod) and flat screen. Because I am a Hilton Honors Gold, they gave us a bottle of good wine. Plus, there were extra little perks like actual coffee beans and grinder! This is an idea I can't believe more hotels dont use! I am a coffee snob, so it was wonderful. Other little amenities were shoe shine kit, bath salts, teas, hot chocolate, popcorn, it was very nice. And, we brought our 2 year old, so he actually got our King bedroom and used the sleeper sofa, which wasn't a good idea. Pretty uncomfortable and hard on the back. My only complaint was that yes, the noise from upstairs woke us all hours of the night. I don't know what those people were doing until 3 am running around, but I was starting to get soooo annoyed because that noise kept waking the baby. I would definitely stay here again, but only if I am gauranteed a 3rd floor room. There was also a lot of foot noise from people walking by... Also, I noticed rooms that faced inside the breakfast/cocktail area, no good. That gets loud, wouldn't recommend that at all. We faced the pool, very nice. Service was outstanding and so were the full breakfasts & cocktail hour. Location, you do have to drive but its central to everything. I think my next stay in the area, I might try Sonoma. Very family friendly town with a great "Square" full of parks for kids, picnic areas and great dining.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find, minus the herd of elephants!”
Reviews.Author: opieluvCA
Reviews.Content: Okay, so we only paid $104 per night, so we have NOTHING to complain about given the average cost of rooms in Napa, but there were a few things that drove us nuts, namely the small herd of elephants living above us and the fact that their pipes seems to have water running on the outside instead of the inside!!! We were on the first floor, a major mistake on our part, but we were with two other couples and in the midst of fun, so who cared, right? Well, at about 6 a.m. our first morning there, we cared, A LOT! As did our friends who had the same experiences in their rooms. The people above us tromped back and forth, rather loudly, for two hours. Just as you fell back to sleep, the creaking floorboard above our bed would scare the heck out of you and set you upright! And everytime they flushed or washed or showered, it sounded like a waterfall was coming down in us. Not nice. After they left, we were calmed by the humming of the maid vacuuming their room! HAHAHAHA This happened both mornings, but it was relatively minor all things considered. But seriously, aside from the two hours in the mornings and the hour or so at night when the elephants above us were active, the hotel was great. The "free" cooked to order breakfast was amazingly good with coffee, juices, tea, bagels, toast, yogurt, fruit, pancakes, eggs, sausage, bacon, etc. All for the taking. We took it all back to our room rather than sit in the atrium and enjoyed our "free" USA Today paper in private. In the evening, the "free" wine, beer, sodas and mixed drinks were an even greater plus, although more booze after a day of wine-tasting was a bit tough and honestly, I could not see getting the best of the Embassy Suites on that deal!! The room was pretty clean and I am a clean freak. The only other complaints, aside from the herd of elephants, was the fact that the two TV remotes did not work and the shower was a light mist. If you are into people spitting on you, then you will be a happy camper. But for what we paid, I was quite happy! Easy to get to, right off the 29 freeway (we backed up to it but heard very lttle to no noise) and close to both St Helena Hwy (the 29) and the Silverado Trail. Also, very close to drug stores and grocery stores as well as a great deli for cheeses and meats to take with you! I cannot remember the name but it is right nextdoor to the Longs Drug in the 1500 block of Trancas Blvd., just a few blocks north of the hotel. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “What a Find!”
Reviews.Author: Cooking1
Reviews.Content: This was an unexpected treat! We truly enjoyed our stay, the room, & the grounds. It was very relaxing to come back to after a full day of visiting wineries. Some of the other reviews said the grounds were hokey but we disagreed. There are beautiful flowers, water features & many little intimate conversation areas to relax in. This is not a luxury property but it is well above the average Embassy Suites. On our last day we were sitting outside in the morning next to the open fire just enjoying our coffee before we checked out & a manager walking by noticed our table had spots on it. He rushed over to wipe them off & apologize. His personal care & wonderful personality were very impressive. We would definitely go back & will recommend it to friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “Prettiest Embassy I've visited ...”
Reviews.Author: misstvlgirl
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful Embassy Suites as far as building exterior, lobby, courtyard and common grounds goes. The rooms were very average. It is nice to have the separate living/sleeping areas but it doesn't allow very much sunlight and the room seems dark and depressing. Rooms seemed outdated, but relatively clean. Hotel not close to anything so you have to drive to shop, explore or eat. It was just okay ....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but our Room was NOT”
Reviews.Author: NEohiotraveler
Reviews.Content: The overall hotel was VERY nice. I really liked the touches that they gave the hotel. (Decor) However, our room as NOT nice. It was old, not very clean, dark and just not comfortable. It gave me the creeps. If my room was outside in the courtyard, it would have probably been better (heee heee) We often wondered since we used "points" that we were given the "C" quality room. We requested another room, but were turned down.

Reviews.Title: “The Essence of Elegance in the Bacchian land of Napa”
Reviews.Author: Ulisse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly an example of sophistication and elegance in an area where it clearly thrives. The pond with its mill wheel in the courtyard presents its white and black swans in the most serene circumstances and sets you in an almost dreamy mood. All that is necessary is here . The pool 's setting is spectacular, the restaurant is set near a lush "bridge" and the suites which appear to have been recently redone are both beautiful as well as practical. The breakfasts are the best I've ever been served and the Manager's Reception in the afternoon easily vie with those on the Riviera or the Amalfi Coast. The lobby gives you the feeling of Hawaii and the towering fireplace reminds one of that trip to a Swiss Chalet-like lodge.But fear not. The rates here are most reasonble for such a feast of all the senses. If you seek a quiet oasis full of ambience and charm yet near the great restaurants and wineries,this is the place you have been looking for in the wine country

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: platinum1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in August. We stayed in one of the rooms surrounding the courtyard. We enjoyed a glass of wine in the courtyard garden one evening. There is an outdoor pool and an indoor pool at the hotel. The indoor pool has a hot tub. The hotel does not have a gym but we were able to use a fully equipped gym about a mile down the street for no charge. Breakfast is served daily and there is a choice of cereals, pastries and fresh fruit. You can also have eggs or an omelet prepared to your liking. The complimentary evening happy hour is served in the same area as the breakfast. Beer, wine and mixed drinks as well as light snacks of chips and salsa, cheese and crackers were served. The hotel is close to downtown Napa so we had dinner at Cole’s Chophouse one night. There were two negatives about the hotel. The first was that we were told that we would not be charged for internet access as we are HH diamond members. When we inquired with the front desk we were told that we should not have been charged and our bill was credited. The second was that there were not any wine glasses in our room. We spoke with other hotel guests who told us their room was equipped with wine glasses. Even given the two negatives we would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely themed, great manager's welcome and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Lislcat
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, with nice amenities. Good location for wine country. We did Napa wineries one day and Sonoma the next. The highway can be a little noisy, but it didn't keep us awake. Lots of room. Great for families. Indoor and outdoor pool, which our daughter loved. Between the drinks and snacks in the evening and the free breakfast, I think it was a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Embassy Suites Experience”
Reviews.Author: greenbeltdan
Reviews.Content: I'm not typically a huge Embassy Suites fan, but this was one of the most pleasant hotel experiences I've had in a while. The hotel has been recently renovated, so the grounds are beautiful and the rooms are new and clean. No obnoxious resort fee either, which is always a plus. The manager's reception was an 'A,' with people taking entire bottles of decent wine back to their tables. The pool and hot tub were very pleasant, and the breakfast was plentiful and very good. I also liked the fact that while there was no on-site fitness center, they provide you with free access to a local health club, which was a big step up from a hotel ftiness center. While I imagine that road noise could be an issue on the side of the hotel facing the highway, we were on the other side, overlooking the main entrance and gardens, which was very pleasant. It's walkable to downtown Napa and 2 minutes from the Premium Outlets, so the location was perfect for my family. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeNCal
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located right off the Highway 29 - can be a plus or minus. For my stay it was plus and easy access to downtown Napa. The hotel does not have a shuttle, but there is a free local trolley. Hotel is standard Embassy, some new renovated rooms and some older rooms, nice evening reception, standard Embassy breakfast with horrible food (I guess some people like it), pool area could be more centeralized and larger - would make it more of a resort. One major draw back is there is no restroom in the lobby. It's a long walk to the restaurant/meeting room to use a bathroom. If you are planning on running in after a long drive to use the facilities, expect a hike and it seems to be the only public restroom on the whole property. Beds are great. Unless you have a flat-screen in your room, the tv's are very old. Overall the hotel is ok, nothing special, but not bad. If the price is right I would stay again, if not go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Highly themed property with all the Embassy extras that people love”
Reviews.Author: Elitefreak
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights with reward points with a family of 4 for a brief tour of wine country between visits to San Francisco and Yosemite. As the website pictures suggested, this property is quite unusual for Embassy Suites in that it is highly themed and memorable. The inner courtyards have bilevel ponds, swans, extensive landscaping, etc. Beautiful, beautiful. Lobby area was equally pleasant (check out the cool turtle footrests). Room was up to normal Embassy standards - nothing more or less. Cocktail reception was better than some Embassy's - cheese, olives, salsa and chips, veggies and dip. Don't spoil your appetite for dinner! Breakfast was also standard Embassy (although some others have more open access to things like bacon/sausage/etc - here all the hot stuff is served by the omlette/egg cooker). As for a GREAT place to eat in Napa, try Zuzu. It was by far the highlight of our 10 day California trip. A tapas place. Fried cheese was yummy. Dip your bread in the sauce that comes with the shrimp; you won't be able to stop. Baby lamb chops - amazing. I'm getting hungry . . . As for earlier posts: - agree that the wierd double doors to the bathroom are annoying, but we got used to it. - freeway noise? We didn't hear a thing. Embassy Suites Napa is a great place to base your wine country sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for the Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: 1eyeclosed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites in Napa for three nights in July of 2006 and we were very satisfied with the location and also the amenities there. The cocktail receptions and breakfasts were very good and the courtyard and lobby areas were top notch. The lobby had a computer with free Internet access even though several teenagers monopolized the PC for most of the time I spent in the lobby. We used the Embassy Suites as a base for our Wine Country exploits (Wine Train, Hot Air Ballooning, wine tastings and tours) and we were not disappointed. The rooms were roomy and comfortable but the only bad mark (and it's a big bad mark) is for the God awful twin louver doors to the bathroom. The doors wouldn't close or open easily and the noise in doing so was not befitting a hotel of this caliber. I realize that the room layouts prevented the use of full size swing out doors but some other door design (pocket door?) could have been used. When you pay the rates they charge, you feel a better design effort could have been made on their part.

Reviews.Title: “Freeway Noise Suites!”
Reviews.Author: ROSEOC
Reviews.Content: They should name this hotel Freeway Noise Suites instead of Embassy Suites. My husband and I went to Napa for a cozy weekend and ended up sleeping in separate beds. The hotel is right off the main freeway so all the rooms with king sized beds are on the backside of the hotel, next to the freeway. You feel as if you are sleeping on the freeway. You look out your window and you see the freeway and you will be listening to it all night long. I thought we would have peace and quite amongst the vineyards in Napa, but not at this hotel you wont. After our first night of no sleep, our only option was to switch to the other side of the hotel and sleep in a double. That was quite a kabash on a romantic weekend with my husband, sleeping in separate beds. My advice would be to stay in a quiet B&B away from the freeway and main town area. My advice is to skip this hotel and go stay in a cozy B&B in Napa. I would only recommend this hotel to business travelers who are alone and who carry earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “4 night stay. Great location. Great property. Feel confident...”
Reviews.Author: Denisetx
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night 5 day stay in Napa Valley. We really enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites. I did tons of research on Napa/Sonoma hotels and felt pretty good before I left. Feel confident this hotel will not let you down. Typical to Better Embassy Suite rooms. Fantastic Service, friendly front desk and bar staff. Great courtyard with real swans! Breakfast served daily as well as the Manager's Cocktail hour (get their Sangria). Lots of variety on both. We paid 264.00 a night, avg for Napa. I travel quite a bit with work and stay at 4 and 5 star properties, so I am picky. I would give this property a solid 3.5 almost a 4. Quiet, clean, great atmosphere and close to downtown Napa and central to visiting alot of the wineries. Speaking of wineries: We suggest going to: Artesa (wines so so, but the view is the best in Napa), Domain Carnaros( we joined their wine club-great terrace where you overlook Carneros region, sipping champagne and having a cheese tray), Sequoia Grove (small boutique, awesome wines and a warm/fuzzy feel, and Cakebread (their wines-need I say more. Their Tour was great, you got to keep you glass, sample 5 wines and a tour for 10.00 a person). Did a private tour and tasting at Seduction Winery-(small boutique feel and just loved it), Monticello was nice and small feel. Did not care for: Hall or St Supery. We did about 10 wineries in 4 days. I highly reccommend not going to the Mondavi's/Beringers..think small boutique and you will enjoy it more. I also reccommend getting the COPIA passport for 5.00 on line. We had tons of two for one tasting coupons which my Husband was thrilled with. That passport saved us over 100.00! We also went to Muir Woods and San Fran for lunch on Memorial Day-broke up all the wine were consuming. We had a convertible so we enjoyed driving around the. I am a huge tripadvisor fan, and so far the reviews of this hotel are spot on. Enjoy your trip, we can't wait to go back and get our wine in the mail. Cheers! Denise and Jason, Flower Mound Texas

Reviews.Title: “Loved Embassy Suites Napa.”
Reviews.Author: MissyMoneyPenny
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend Embassy Suites Hotel Napa Valley. My parents, husband and I stayed at the Embassy Suites hotel for 2 nights on in April 2007 and thoroughly enjoyed it. The Embassy Suites Napa Valley has an excellent set up and really stands out for excellent customer service. (We have stayed in many hotels). The management and staff go over and beyond what is required. In particular we found Norma to be extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast in the mornings was delicious and passes to the gym a nice touch. Incidentally we experienced no problems with queues at breakfast time contrary to previous reviews. The managers reception in the evening was one of the best we have enjoyed. We didnt eat in the hotel restaurant in the evenings, preferring instead to explore the area. We had a lovely meal in Celadon on the second night. Many Thanks to all the staff Embassy Suites Napa for a wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: havanahipster
Reviews.Content: We visit Napa Valley quite frequently for work purposes, but I am writing this review from a consumer perspective. This is a great value in Napa compared to other hotels. The grounds are beautifully manicured with swans, waterfalls, and lush greenery. The hotel has a wine country/Mediterranean feel that is very charming and inviting. The hotel offers a happy hour from 5pm to 7pm and features free wine/mixed drinks and light appetizers. It's great to sit on the outside patio and enjoy the gratis food and drink. Rooms are standard Embassy Suite rooms but they seem cleaner than the average Embassy rooms. Definitely a good value. Plenty of parking. Great front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the grounds”
Reviews.Author: Jillybeanpink
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed only 1 night. We had an easy check in. The Lobby was beautiful. The front desk has maps of the area. They also have sample menus of some of the restaurants. There is a small gift shop in in the lobby area. The computer is located for guests by the lobby front desk. The grounds are beautiful. Lovely plants and ponds with swans and ducks. There were baby ducks and baby swans when we were there. My husband and I had a King bed suite on the 3 rd floor. Our room entrance was actually inside the atruium. Some rooms were outside. There was a free reception in the afternoon from 5:30 - 7:30. There were free drinks and appetizers. We took our refreshments to the outside pond area that had table and chairs. There were some people who were smoking outside, and since we are not smokers and I am highly allergic to smoke we had to change out seats to get away from the smoke outside.There was no smoking inside. Our room was quite lovely. The bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was very good. Lots of choices. The inside garden where the breakfast is has real trees growing and a pond with Koi with a very nice bridge. The help there is quite nice and always asking if they can bring you coffee or take away your dirty plates. If you don't want to go out to dinner there is a restaurant on the premises. If you want to swim there is an outside pool as well as an inside pool with a spa. We paid $104 a night, a government rate. We would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: daisy47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites on April 5 for one night and it was $128 a night. We were visiting Napa and then on our way to San Francisco. We arrived around midnight. The lobby was very pretty and grand looking. It was a large room with a fireplace and lots of chairs, internet access, a kiosk to print out airplane tickets, water and coffee and the front desk. Checking in was a breeze. The front desk person was very nice. The lobby is indoors but the hallways to the rooms are outdoors. They have a cover so you wouldn't get rained on. I have kind of made it a rule not to stay anywhere with outside hallways because in my experience, they are usually skanky and shady places but I took a chance because this place looked nice and was a GREAT price to stay in Napa. We took the elevator to the 2nd floor and it was confusing signage to find our room. The room was awesome. It was beautiful and very big. There was a living room and bar when you walked in. It was very homey. A couch, a tv, chairs, a kitchen table, a coffee table, and the bar with stools. There are lots of books about the local wineries, how much tastings are, restaurants, things to do, etc. The bathroom was also very nice (the usual marble with the shower and curved shower curtain for more room). The doors were weird though. It was two little skinny doors that closed together (but opened separately) and one was on a hinge so the doors couldn't stay open. They automatically closed. No big deal, just weird and annoying. The bedroom had a sink and mirror (convenient to get make up on when someone is in the bathroom). There was a king bed and a TV and end tables. The bed was VERY comfortable and there were sound machine alarm clocks that could wake you up by your MP3 player or sounds (like the ocean, the rain, etc) or the alarm noise or radio. I believe the bedroom was facing the highway ramp but I didn't not hear anything from the highway at all. The room was very quiet. I did not hear anyone that night or the next day. The living room faced the courtyard which was really pretty. There was an outdoor pool, a pond with swans and tables and chairs, a gazebo and a little mill. The next morning we went to the free deluxe hot breakfast that was included. I was so impressed. It was in a nice restaurant part and there was lots of drinks (juices, coffee, milk, water, etc), cold food (cereal, fruit, danishes, bagels, bread, etc), a omelet making station (lots of options, made to order, bacon, sausage, potatoes), pancakes, waffles. Maybe more but I didn't notice. The omelet was very good. The potatoes weren't that great but they were free so who cares? It was a very good breakfast for free. It was a good breakfast for money. It was the same thing you would get at any breakfast restaurant. I don't think you could go back for more omelets, bacon or sausage (though they probably wouldn't care) but the rest of the food was like a buffet. There was also an indoor pool and spa that looked nice. The free internet in the lobby was available when we arrived at midnight but checking out on a Friday morning around 11, there was basically a line for it. One guy would NOT get off even though people were waiting. I also heard the airline ticket kiosk thing was not working. Checkout was also easy. You can check out from your room or at the front desk and there weren't any people at the desk waiting. The front desk people were very polite giving us winery maps and two "buy one, get one free" tasting coupons at two wineries. Ask for those. Napa charges at almost every winery for tastings and it is between $5 and $30 (except fancy special reserve tastings). Most places were $10 for a 4 tastings. The hotel was in a good location. Right in downtown Napa and there are wineries everywhere though the bigger ones are probably 15 minutes away. TIP: GO TO THE NAPA VISITORS CENTER. There was a man there selling resort condos who gave us a tasting card for free tastings at like 10 wineries. He didn't even force a sales pitch. He asked how long we'd be there and if we had time to look at the condos, we'd get a $100 restaurant gift card for Napa OR San Fran. It actually seemed reasonable but we said we would only be there until 5 PM and that was it. No pressure at all from him. He was very nice. Plus, we got maps and recommendations for wineries and places to eat. It was well worth it. Napa is not as nice as Sonoma in my opinion. Much more built up (even in the wineries section). Not as much individual service at the tastings. Sonoma had all free tastings pretty much except reserve wines and most places gave us those for free too. They were a little friendlier in Sonoma. Sonoma was also much prettier and picturesque like you'd picture in the movies or on a postcard. Now, Napa was very nice but I'd head to Sonoma if you have the time. I am saying Napa but I mean Napa Valley (St Helena, Rutherford, etc). They are all next to each other. One place we did not like was V. Sattui Winery. They are one of the only free tasting places and it shows. It was SO crowded that they wouldn't even serve us. They have specific sections to be served (certain parts of the bar, they literally just ignore you. Literally. There were lots of angry people trying to talk to someone). When they do serve you, they are rushed and rude, they don't give you any time. There is barely room to move. On the bright side, they have good wine and they have a deli/market section with GREAT food. That is part of the reason they are so popular. The food is so good and there are tables to eat at outside. Go for the food, go elsewhere for tastings. In summation, the hotel was great. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rubhed
Reviews.Content: Good Evening, I would like to start this review with my first impression. The entrance is very nice rustic napa. The staff is friendly but not much beyond that. The grounds are pretty. The ponds with the swans, ducks and turtles was fantastic. The rooms are the same size whether you get the standard or the executive. The hotel is right next to the freeway so if you want a standard queen room they are all facing the freeway. Twins and executive rooms are on the other side of the property. If you don't like freeway noice i suggest you either upgrade or ask for a twin room away from the freeway. The rooms are kind of odd shaped, but they ok. The pictures included are from the executive room. The managers receprion is nice, bu they use cheap booze and the food is just chips celery dip. It is free and free is good. Hint : They have Jim Beam. It is the only name brand alcohol they have. Again it's free and free is good :). The breakfast is nice. The trick is to get to breakfast early. I think it starts at 7:30am. It is made to order and the omlets are great. The staff lights the fireplaces in the morning so you can sit by a noce fire while eating breakfast. One problem i found is that the walls are kind of thin and you can hear people sometimes walking above you. This is very minor compared to the freeway. :). Overall I really enjoyed this hotel and will be staying here next time I am in Napa. I paid $135/ Night. I thought this was a fair price. I don't think it is worth $200 +, but $135 is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Never again at Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: chicagogirl77
Reviews.Content: My husband is a Hilton Diamond Honors member, so we were very excited to stay at the Embassy Suites in Napa. From the moment we walked in, to the moment we left...we were very disappointed. Upon arrival, there was construction in the lobby. Sheets were thrown over chairs, scaffolding was everywhere. No apologies were made for this ever. We got to our room, and it reeked of mildew and mothballs. The stairwells leading up to the 2nd floor were no better. Our room, was dark and stuffy, and just left us with a greasy feeling. After a day out at wineries we made it down the manager's cocktail hour, that was from 5-6pm, and we probably got there around 5:15. There was no food left anywhere, and no one was refilling anything, the line for drinks was about 20-30 people deep. Such a disappointment. The next morning the "included" breakfast was no better. While the food was fine, you had to wait in line as if you were in a cattle call. I felt like I was in college again, when the cafeteria opened late on Sunday morning. For being a diamond member, we were hugely disappointed...this is a category 6 for hilton, and i would say it's more of a catogory 3. We were traveling with my husband's clients, and thank goodness they chose a better hotel over the River. We would have been embarrassed if they stayed at the same place.

Reviews.Title: “Get the Romantic Room!”
Reviews.Author: boxsters
Reviews.Content: Normally when we stay at the Embassy in Napa - it's just ok. Nothing special - but we get enough room for the whole family, plus breakfast included - it's convenient! This time - my husband & I were able to bok a "Romantic" package, which I'd never seen at this Embassy before. The room was exceptional! Canopy bed, romantic furnishings & decor, a roomy glass shower, A COFFEE GRINDER, LARGE COFFEE POT & BEANS!!!! This was so enjoyable! Plasma tv was favorable to the hubby. We'd book the same roon in a heartbeat! We were giddy w/our choice. The water ponds w/the birds was relaxing. We lit the chiminea in the courtyard for extra heat while sipping our cocktails - - it couldn't be beat! The bed was the best. HEAVENLY!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed at the Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: luvinlife50
Reviews.Content: I really expected much more from an Embassy Suites hotel. I don't usually complain much but there was just too many disappointments. My husband and I drove over to Napa for the weekend to celebrate my 50th BD. I was surprised to drive up and find no overhang/awning to park under (it was pouring down rain). Also, there is no one to help with baggage or even a restroom in the lobby. After we checked in we were told to drive around to the back of the complex and find one of 3 entrances with awnings the get you into the building. There is absolutely no signage outside of the doors and it was difficult to find our room once we got inside (no signs with room numbers and arrows directing you). Once inside, the very dark room had a very strong mildew smell but after driving for 3 hours in the rain and struggling with luggage, finding the room, etc. I didn't have the energy to ask for and move to another room. The room was also warm and stuffy with no A/C to cool it off. We opened the window but then heard the very close highway noise. When we checked in the front desk asked if I'd like a complimentary bottle of wine for my birthday and I had the choice of white or red. Ordered white and red was delivered. The sheets and towels were the roughest and cheapest quality I've ever had in any hotel. The hair dryer is placed in a fancy black bag with a tied rope around it which sits high on a stand on the bathroom counter. At least on Sunday (when I got nosy and looked in the bag) I got to dry my hair. Saturday morning I received an in-room massage that my daughter had scheduled for me. She told me that she had pre-paid for it and that I should just pay the tip just in case it wasn't up to par. When we received our bill a charge ($90) for the massage had been added. I called the spa and the very nice lady said she'd call the front desk, take care of it and call me right back in which she did. I thought the $90 charge was odd since the massage therapist didn't have me sign anything for payment, meaning she already knew it was paid for. The breakfast and the manager's get together in the early evening were good. When we went to check out on the tv - I was going to fill out the survery but - "it wasn't in service". At least we enjoyed a couple of restaurants I had researched on the web (Rutherford's Grill and The Bounty Hunter).

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: kittymama76
Reviews.Content: This is a very convenient place to stay in Napa for a great value. The hotel is located just next to the highway 29 which allows you to jump on the wine trail with ease. The lobby is cozy and lovely, and the rooms are comfortable and clean. As with all Embassy Suites, it is quite nice to have a separate living room and bar area. The breakfast was fantastic, with fresh fruits and made-to-order omelets made by the friendly staff. The managers reception was fair, with minimal snacks and a lack of quality drinks. This is really insignificant considering the overall quality of the hotel. A highlight was the display of beautiful black and white swans in the pond!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Geppetto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites in Napa for our Wedding Anniversary in December of 2006. Here is a breakdown of what I thought: Location: This hotel is very easy to find, right off the main freeway which is also one of it's downfalls as many of the rooms on the back side get a view of the freeway. It is almost a suburban area of napa with residential homes nearby and Downtown Napa a few miles away which was nice. Appearance: The hotel has a winery/tuscan feel to it and is spectacular. There are little touches of detail everywhere including a big pond with a water-wheel house and swans in it. Fountains and neatley kept garden areas in various places. The thems is seen inside and out...very impressive. Room: The Embassy Suites always delivers with the rooms. We got the standard living area, kitchenette, full bath, and bedroom. Nothing to complain about, everything was very clean and well kept. Service: The staff was friendly and very helpful. The front desk offers free concierge service. They gave us directions and offered to make reservations if we needed. My only complaint is that it took a while to get extra utinsels delivered to our room one night. Food: The free hot breakfast is great, we didn't eat at the restaurant there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good stay overall”
Reviews.Author: east12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for 4 nights over the second weekend in October. The hotel was fully booked, but some rooms are not being used as they are still being renovated. If you are sensitive to paint odors, you may want to ask for a room away from areas being painted. The hotel is nicely located in Napa, an easy drive to restaurants and shops, and an easy drive to Sonoma or Napa Valley. In advance, we had requested a room away from the highway. Check-in was very efficient and the staff friendly and acccomodating overall. The bed was very comfortable and bath towels were nice and white and fluffy. However, there are no towel bars in the bathroom. The doors to the bath are sort of a french door and awkward to get around. There is a nice high counter/bar area that houses the mini-fridge and microwave. Our room had a coffee grinder and whole beans. The hotel offers a free full breakfast and cocktails in the evening (though we skipped that.) The hotel has a pleasant pond and patio area. We would stay here again the next time we go to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Garden”
Reviews.Author: alexmodrok
Reviews.Content: Very good Hotel for excursions in the Napa valley. Rooms are very nice, big and newly renovated with new carpets. Unfortunately the renovation is still ongoing, but has not so much disturbed us. The rooms facing to the motorway need better noise reduction. The evening reception is nice and the wines are good, but should better served always in wine glasses. One day I got the wine in paper cups. Overall quite good.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel we've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: michelecm
Reviews.Content: This hotel gives you soooo much for your money! Complimentary FULL b'fast every morning, internet access int he lobby, OPEN bar for 2 hrs every night w/ light snacks (veges,chips, etc.) First it is in a perfect location, equal distance from napa and sonoma so everywhere is only 20 minutes away. San Fran is 50 min. Secondly the grounds are gorgeous, immaculately kept with a peaceful pond area to eat/drink by. Thirdly the restaurant is FAB! we never left the grounds for dinner, there was no need to since the food was absolutely delicious. We loved the 2 rooms feel, the bar area was very cool and parking is free! We HIGHLY recommend this hotel and will definitely come back to it and send others their way too!

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Hotel in Napa”
Reviews.Author: SLOJJ
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend at the Embassy Suites with our 2 1/2 year old son. This was our third stay at the Embassy Suites, and we will continue to return because of its excellent value and service. While the hotel caters primarily to business and leisure travelers (we only saw two other children during our stay), the staff are very family friendly. The hotel is located directly off Highway 29, the main artery through Napa, St. Helena, and Calistoga. Most of the wineries are at least 15 - 20 minutes away, but the drive through scenic wine country is lovely. The grounds of the hotel are tranquil and my son loved watching the swans in the small courtyard lagoon. If you are traveling with small children who nap during the day or go to bed early, I recommend requesting a suite at the front of the hotel, as the rooms at the rear can be noisy due to traffic. Because we were traveling with friends (and our toddler had no interest in wine tasting), we used a nanny service recommended by the hotel. Our son adored his nanny from "Take a Break." We also found the best playground we've ever seen (appropriately called Playground Fantastico) on the other side of the highway, just past the Napa Outlets and next to a middle school. The complimentary breakfast in the morning is extensive and includes omelets, boiled eggs, fruit, pancakes, french toast, bacon, sausage, cereals, bagels, yogurt, and several juices. The hotel also serves free cocktails and wine in the atrium from 5:30 - 7:30 p.m. The suite's kitchenette includes a refrigerator perfectly sized for storing picnic provisions, as well as a microwave and coffeemaker. Trader Joe's and Peet's Coffee are just a short drive away.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: canthavedmango
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great place to stay. We had a great stay and would stay again. Free breakfast, and it was nice, mabe not the most fancy foods but really nice for the price (Free). Also another nice perk was the free drinks every night from 530 to 730pm. The rooms were great. and had everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for slippery tiles at indoor pool”
Reviews.Author: noryglory
Reviews.Content: This was just fine for our trip to visit family who live nearby. We stayed with our two small children, one in a portacrib and one in the hideabed in the sitting area. I like the separate bedroom for the adults. We were there while they were remodeling but stayed in the back, it seemed at the time that the rooms at the front of the hotel were being remodeled, but there were lots of dumpsters around, furniture being moved in and out, etc. Didn't bother us during the stay but definitely noticed it when outside the hotel, coming and going. Sorry to see that we just missed a renovated room, it did seem a bit dated but clean and spacious enough. My biggest complaint is the indoor pool. The tile, while beautiful, stays very wet and very slippery. I had a vice grip on my two-year-old's hand the entire time he was out and he slipped on almost every step he took. My six-year-old, entering the pool area carefully with athletic shoes on, slipped and fell right before I said "be very careful, the tile is slippery." Luckily he fell well and wasn't hurt but it is shocking to me that they haven't corrected this problem with better surfacing. Young, old and in-between could be seriously hurt and they could face lawsuits on a regular basis. This must be fixed. The breakfast, while free, reminded me of a cafeteria or dorm, it wasn't that great. But there were lots of choices and it was nice to serve ourselves and be done with breakfast quickly with two little kids ready to start their day and not sit still for long. The atrium is a nice setting for a quick bite with kids, a group of travellers, or for a business traveller. The hotel sits right on Highway 29 and in fact our room faced the back of the property and the highway, however, the noise wasn't bad. Just be aware of this if that view would bother you to be sure to upgrade to something with a different view. The price was right for us and we weren't there for the ambiance. I would not recommend this as a romantic hotel for couples travelling in wine country. There surely are more attractive options. From the outside it is a nice looking hotel, and the inner courtyard is quite pretty and the swans in the "old mill" area are fun to watch. The "vibe" however is not very interesting otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Good Napa location”
Reviews.Author: Existent
Reviews.Content: Best hotel in Napa by far. A little expensive but worth it. The cooked to order breakfast and dinner reception was a nice extra.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast, hotel just ok”
Reviews.Author: DLapeyre
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on our vacation. Pulling into the hotel had to park way in the back because it was so full. Kind of seedy and had construction workers staring out some of the windows at us. We had so much wine and stuff in our car I did not feel secure at all and moved it as soon as I could get a space in the front of the hotel. When checking in discovered the front desk clerk was brand new and took awhile to check us in. The hotel had construction workers everywhere which made my 21 year daughter uncomfortable. Only one elevator working and it was always full of construction workers and materials and a huge mess. When we get to our room the key does not work. I have to go through the whole waiting 5 minutes on the elevator, etc and go back down to the font desk where the kid gets me new keys. When we finally get in to the room it was newly decorated and spacious. We use the toilet and it starts overflowing all over the floor for no reason. So we have to move to another room, back down to the front desk...new set of keys again. Rough start but now for the good stuff. Great breakfast served in the atrium. Grounds were nice, location was close to downtown Napa and easy to get to. But by far the best thing was the MASSAGES in room. I had booked online on the hotels website. Both my daughter and I thought the girls who did them were the best we have ever had. I had the Down Under which was alot of feet and calves, also neck and shoulder and my daughter had a deep tissue Swedish massage. I wish I could remember their names to refer by name. On our trip to California we first stayed at the Ritz Carlton Half Moon Bay and the Inn of the Spanish Garden in Santa Barbara which were both 5 star excellent hotels so compared to those this hotel was just OK but I would recommend if you are going to Napa and I would probably stay there again since the construction would be done. That was the main complaint and is a temporary thing.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, wonderful service,”
Reviews.Author: ginkdeal
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 day Napa visit and this hotel was by far the best. The hotel itself is just beautiful- a lovely rose garden surrounds the pool. Breakfast is served each morning and you can return to a lovely cocktail party every afternoon. Spacious clean rooms, charming and helpful staff. What a value!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for wineries & downton Napa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When you hit *22 on your phone, you can get an in-room massage. That was incredibly convenient. The breakfast was good, just what you expect from an Embassy, and the location was perfect (albeit a tad south) for all the wineries. An excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel ”
Reviews.Author: Pete69
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Embassy Suites Napa Valley as part of a coach tour from Britain. What a great hotel. The rooms were huge and very well furnished. The happy hour in the bar was extremely well attended by both our tour members and Americans alike and the complimentary breakfast was outstanding. A very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: Jamie B
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Embassy Suites in Napa a few times now and I have to say that every time has been a great experience. The rooms are great, the complimentary happy hour is awesome and the included breakfast is very good. It's a bit out of the Napa valley, but it's near a lot of great restaurants in downtown Napa. It can be a bit pricey, but what isn't in Napa Valley these days? Highly recommended for a romantic weekend in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “The renovated room is great”
Reviews.Author: G8R
Reviews.Content: I must have stayed in one of the renovated rooms. It was very nice, as I would expect of Embassy Suites. This is not your typical Embassy Suites. It seems to be an older hotel converted to Embassy suites. There is a three story outdoor building surrounding a swimming pool. And there is a three story indoor atrium area containing the breakfast area and restaurant. Even though I was taken aback by the outdoor buildings, my room was very nice. I would say as nice as any Embassy suites room I've stayed, and much nicer than a couple. Probably because everything seemed new. Some of the room are still being renovated, but it was no bother at all since I was in meetings all day anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Peech
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 1 night, didn't get to see much of the hotel or use any of the facilities. The suite was compact but had everything we needed. For the price I think it's not bad.

Reviews.Title: “right for the price”
Reviews.Author: krohrig
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed Christmas weekend. For the price, it was perfect. We paid $149.00 per night. At Embassy Suites you receive a full breakfast buffet and they have cocktail hour every night. The hotel is very close to downtown and all the wineries. We flew into Oakland and it was less than an hours drive. The hotel staff was very helpful in letting us know what was opened that weekend. They have free internet access in the lobby. There is an outlet mall very close by. There is an iron, hair dryer, refrigerator, coffee maker with fresh whole bean coffee in the room. It was a pleasant stay and we would stay there again. When we checked out on December 26, 2005, they said that the hotel was going to be remodeled within the next few days. You might want to call ahead to see is if the remodeling has been completed.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at other Hilton properties, we were very disappointed at the state of this hotel. We decided to splurge on the price, fully expecting a very nice room and found that it is in desperate need of remodeling. The beds were comfortable-they had just replaced all the mattresses, but the rooms/carpet were outdated and worn. First night, the room smelled musty. We asked to be moved the next morning and were. The next room looked just the same, but no musty smell. They told me at the desk that the hotel was slated to be rennovated at the end of the year. Breakfast was good, staff was very helpful and friendly. It was nice to stay in Napa after visiting wineries all day. Nice courtyard complete with ponds and swans-nice touch. Would consider staying there again once it is remodeled, otherwise I would look for other accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Only Redeeming Quality: Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: mibell4e
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 10th wedding anniversary during Memorial Weekend 2005. I booked a little late, so there was not much else available - but because Embassy Suites has a fairly good reputation, I decided to try it. We were VERY disappointed. The only good thing I can say is that the lobby is nice and they had excellent customer service. The Manager was very apologetic and tried to make us comfortable. Our first room smelled very bad and did not have a good view - was on the ground floor. The smell was hard to describe - it was a musty/moldy/wet dog-that-had-tried-to-be-masked-by-cleaning-products-kind-of-smell. Very nasty. We asked to be moved, and were put into an upstairs room with an even worse view. This room smelled equally as bad, we finally gave up and opened up the door in the "living room" and the sliding glass door in the bedroom for a few hours to air it out. The "suite" was very small and dark and the bedroom side was located right next to the freeway. The bed, along with the rest of the furniture, was very hard and uncomfortable - we did not sleep well AT ALL. The room seemed fairly clean, but not the cleanest I've seen. The decor was very dated and worn. It was Motel-6 quality - which is fine if you booked at Motel-6 - not OK if you booked a $199/night "Suite". The cocktail hour was OK. They had a fairly well-stocked bar - I liked that I could order mixed drinks. The snacks consisted of a veggie tray, chips/salsa, olives and a cracker/cheese/meat tray. It was decent, but just the basics. The breakfast was OK. Everything, except for the omelets, were pre-made and kept under heating lights. The only omelet available was ham & cheese with a choice of onions, peppers and mushrooms. Bagels and toaster were available - that was nice. After the 1st night I used the computer in the lobby to book a room at the Park Hyatt in San Francisco (nothing else available in Napa area). Luckily, the Manager was very nice and let check-out after only one night, despite the 2 night minimum. He also reduced the price from $199 to $149. He was extremely nice and helpful - even gave us directions to San Francisco via the Golden Gate Bridge. As a side note - had a wonderful time in SF. The Park Hyatt was very nice, excellent staff and good location. Also, the city was practically empty for Memorial Weekend, which we very much enjoyed. They also had great rates at most of the nicest hotels there. We paid $179 for a very nice room with a beautiful view. The only downside is that parking was $40 plus tax. Although, had we booked earlier, and for more than one night, we could have gotten a better rate that included free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay in the heart of wine country”
Reviews.Author: JacksonPA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were lookinf for a weekend getaway in Northern California. The Napa/Sonoma valley is amazingly beautiful. The Hotel was near much of the historic areas and the wineries. The hotel staff and the atmosphere was incredibably relaxing. A very, very nice stay. Great rooms and excellent food. A++++

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfect But Still a Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: TravelinCanuck
Reviews.Content: My wife attended a medical conference here for several days and my 16 year old son and I tagged along with her for the stay. I was informed that this is the original Embassy Suites. It's an older hotel for sure but we enjoyed the atmosphere of the place with the historic winery items and the outside courtyard with the natural pond like setting. Although the spa was being renovated during our stay we enjoyed the indoor and outdoor pools although they are quite small. We especially enjoyed the free continental breakfast and two hour happy hour. Other hotels take note! Our suite was excellent- roomy, clean and modern. The service was erratic at times but for the most part the staff was courteous and helpful. The location is very central- close to downtown Napa, Yountville and the valley itself. We've stayed at other nice places in this area and this hotel is right up there with them. Highly recommended!

HotelInfo.Name: Embassy Suites Hotel Napa Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 1075 California Blvd, Napa, CA 94559
